{"compliance_id": "a72c59c8-bb3b-f011-a373-0050568a2d1a", "document_type": "Incident", "document_url": "https://data.epa.ie/leap/api/v1/Incident/byid?incident_id=a72c59c8-bb3b-f011-a373-0050568a2d1a", "title": "", "description": "Notification of an uncontrolled release from the public network on the 20/05/2025 in Dara Court, Celbridge. Following receipt of a complaint for an UCR, investigations by UE wastewater operatives identified a faulty non- return valve in a network manhole which resulted in a release to a hardstanding area, to the rear of a private dwelling in this estate. Investigations confirmed, following heavy rainfall on the 20/05/2025, the network appeared to be filling up and surcharging via the foul line. See attached location map for reference (with the manhole and location of the faulty NRV circled). There was a 'Yellow weather warning' was in operation on the 20/05/2025 from 3pm to 8pm for scattered thunder storms with spot flooding and lightening damage in this region. To note, release was dilute in nature due to increased infiltration to the network following heavy rainfall. Operatives arranged for a jetter crew to clean the affected area on the 21/05/2025. Contractors engaged to quote for replacing this faulty NRV which should prevent further overflows. \r\n", "submission_date": "", "status": "Closed", "metadata": "{\"incidentid\": \"a72c59c8-bb3b-f011-a373-0050568a2d1a\", \"type\": \"Incident\", \"reference\": \"INCI030400\", \"subject\": \"Uncontrolled Release\", \"status\": \"Closed\", \"licenceid\": \"20ae6d39-53a3-e211-9bc8-0050568a69e2\", \"licenceprofileid\": \"7196c04b-4bd8-478e-99af-010482136e26\", \"complianceinvestigationid\": null, \"incidentcategory\": \"1. title: Document request following visit 16/04/25
metadata_json:
{"compliance_id": "eb43b447-7f1f-f011-a373-0050568a2d1a", "document_type": "Site Updates/Notifications", "document_url": "https://data.epa.ie/leap/api/v1/LicenseeReturns/byid?lr_id=eb43b447-7f1f-f011-a373-0050568a2d1a", "title": "Document request following visit 16/04/25", "description": "Please see attached following requested documentation following EPA site visit to Sherwin Williams Ireland 16/04/25.
Final drawing for stack emissions point and access platform.
Data for Gas Boiler on site for Warehouse heating. Model is the 150X.
Stormwater monitoring sheets for 2024 & 2025, we clarified with staff that samples are retrieved on each occasion and assessed. 
WTF's for Hazardous waste taken off site for 2024 and 2025 YTD. 
The query raised in relation to an unlicensed emissions point in the spray room was already addressed in Licensee Return LR067909.", "submission_date": "", "status": "Closed", "metadata": "{"licenseereturnid": "eb43b447-7f1f-f011-a373-0050568a2d1a", "type": "Site Updates/Notifications", "reference": "LR093762", "subject": "Site Updates/Notifications:Other", "status": "Closed", "licenceid": "dcc7e87d-7c61-e211-9eb5-0050568a69e2", "licenceprofileid": "fc399d74-4faf-49a6-aadd-c565638944c3", "datereceived": "2025-04-22T00:00:00", "closeddate": "2025-06-26T00:00:00", "title": "Document request following visit 16/04/25", "doctype": "Site Updates/Notifications", "docsubtype": "Other", "decision": "Assessed", "description": "Please see attached following requested documentation following EPA site visit to Sherwin Williams Ireland 16/04/25.\r\nFinal drawing for stack emissions point and access platform.\r\nData for Gas Boiler on site for Warehouse heating. title: Q3 Ploughing commencement notice
metadata_json:
{"compliance_id": "caf45ba4-c551-f011-a373-0050568a2d1a", "document_type": "Site Updates/Notifications", "document_url": "https://data.epa.ie/leap/api/v1/LicenseeReturns/byid?lr_id=caf45ba4-c551-f011-a373-0050568a2d1a", "title": "Q3 Ploughing commencement notice", "description": "Dear Sir/Madam, 
 
Port of Waterford hereby gives the Environmental Protection Agency notice under Condition 2.5 of Dumping at Sea Permit S0012-03, as amended, that we wish to conduct maintenance plough dredging in the third quarter of 2025. Ploughing will primarily occur at Cheekpoint Lower Bar. Ploughing may also be undertaken at Cheekpoint Inner Harbour Access Channel and Belview Berths. 

The expected campaign windows are outlined below: 
 
13/07/2025	to	18/07/2025
26/07/2025	to	31/07/2025
11/08/2025	to	16/08/2025
24/08/2025	to	29/08/2025
08/09/2025	to	13/09/2025
22/09/2025	to	27/09/2025

All dates proposed for the Q3 campaigns fall within spring tide cycles.
A 'Notice to Mariners' will be posted on our website, www.portofwaterford.com   


Sincerely,
Ian Moriarty", "submission_date": "", "status": "Closed", "metadata": "{"licenseereturnid": "caf45ba4-c551-f011-a373-0050568a2d1a", "type": "Site Updates/Notifications", "reference": "LR095504", "subject": "Site Updates/Notifications:Loading and Dumping Commencement Notice", "status": "Closed", "licenceid": "a315b192-5ad4-42b7-a167-962202f5e2f8", "licenceprofileid": "d3e61a83-98a6-e611-8d41-0050568a69e2", "datereceived": "2025-06-25T00:00:00", "closeddate": "2025-06-25T00:00:00", "title": "Q3 Ploughing commencement notice", "doctype": "Site Updates/Notifications", "docsubtype": "Loading and Dumping Commencement Notice", "decision": "Assessed", "description": "Dear Sir/Madam, \r\n \r\nPort of Waterford hereby gives the Environmental Protection Agency notice under Condition 2.5 of Dumping at Sea Permit S0012-03, as amended, that we wish to conduct maintenance plough dredging in the third quarter of 2025. Ploughing will primarily occur at Cheekpoint Lower Bar. Ploughing may also be undertaken at Cheekpoint Inner Harbour Access Channel and Belview Berths. \r\n\r\nThe expected campaign windows are outlined below: \r\n \r\n13/07/2025\tto\t18/07/2025\r\n26/07/2025\tto\t31/07/2025\r\n11/08/2025\tto\t16/08/2025\r\n24/08/2025\tto\t29/08/2025\r\n08/09/2025\tto\t13/09/2025\r\n22/09/2025\tto\t27/09/2025\r\n\r\nAll dates proposed for the Q3 campaigns fall within spring tide cycles.\r\nA 'Notice to Mariners' will be posted on our website, www.portofwaterford.com   \r\n\r\n\r\nSincerely,\r\nIan Moriarty", "documentcategory": null, "complianceinvestigationid": null}"}

{"compliance_id": "ec928183-ec37-f011-a373-0050568a2d1a", "document_type": "Incident", "document_url": "https://data.epa.ie/leap/api/v1/Incident/byid?incident_id=ec928183-ec37-f011-a373-0050568a2d1a", "title": "", "description": "There was an emergency overflow from the plant on the 20/05/2025 following a lightening storm which impacted the VSD's at the the WWtP. More than 90 alarms were generated at the plant following this thunder and lightening event resulting in the VSD units loosing power. To note, there was a 'Yellow weather warning' in operation for Co. Kildare for scattered thunder storms with spot flooding and lightening damage possible. This weather warning was in effect on the 20/05/2025 from 3pm to 8pm. This EO commenced at approx. 5pm and ceased at 6pm following the restoration of power to the affected VSD units at the plant. A visual inspection of the outfall and river on the 21/05/2024 determined there was no adverse impact to note, with no clean- up required. A total volume of 1,058m3 was discharge during this event. \r\nAmbient sampling of the river upstream and downstream was completed on the 22/05/2025 with the following results yielded; Upstream- ammonia 0.26 mg/l and Ortho-P <0.05 mg/l. Downstream- ammonia 0.13 mg/l and Ortho-P <0.05 mg/l. Final effluent process results on the 22/05/2025 yielded complaint results also, ammonia 0.07 mg/l and Ortho-P 0.08 mg/l. Further process testing of the final effluent on the 23/05/2025 yielded the following results; ammonia 0.05 mg/l and Ortho-P 0.065 mg/l. The plant is back fully operational since power was restored to the VSD units on the 20/05/2025 at 6pm with the overflow ceasing. There are no further issues to note since this weather event. ", "submission_date": "", "status": "Closed", "metadata": "{\"incidentid\": \"ec928183-ec37-f011-a373-0050568a2d1a\", \"type\": \"Incident\", \"reference\": \"INCI030382\", \"subject\": \"Uncontrolled Release\", \"status\": \"Closed\", \"licenceid\": \"20ae6d39-53a3-e211-9bc8-0050568a69e2\", \"licenceprofileid\": \"7196c04b-4bd8-478e-99af-010482136e26\", \"complianceinvestigationid\": null, \"incidentcategory\": \"1. Minor\", \"nature\": \"Uncontrolled Release\", \"vulnerablereceptors\": \"River Liffey\\r\\n\", \"receptors\": \"Water\", \"likelihoodofreoccurence\": \"Low\", \"likelycause\": \"Emergency overflow caused by power failure\", \"newrecurring\": \"New\", \"datenotified\": \"2025-05-23T00:00:00\", \"closeddate\": \"2025-06-24T00:00:00\", \"approximatestart\": \"2025-05-20T17:00:00\", \"firstnoticed\": \"2025-05-20T17:00:00\", \"finishtime\": \"2025-05-20T18:00:00\", \"notifiedparties\": \"Kildare County Council, Inland Fisheries Ireland\", \"dischargepoint\": \"Yes\", \"emissionpointname\": null, \"uncontrolledrelease\": \"There was an emergency overflow from the plant on the 20/05/2025 following a lightening storm which impacted the VSD's at the the WWtP. More than 90 alarms were generated at the plant following this thunder and lightening event resulting in the VSD units loosing power. To note, there was a 'Yellow weather warning' in operation for Co. Kildare for scattered thunder storms with spot flooding and lightening damage possible. This weather warning was in effect on the 20/05/2025 from 3pm to 8pm. This EO commenced at approx. 5pm and ceased at 6pm following the restoration of power to the affected VSD units at the plant. A visual inspection of the outfall and river on the 21/05/2024 determined there was no adverse impact to note, with no clean- up required. A total volume of 1,058m3 was discharge during this event. \\r\\nAmbient sampling of the river upstream and downstream was completed on the 22/05/2025 with the following results yielded; Upstream- ammonia 0.26 mg/l and Ortho-P <0.05 mg/l. Downstream- ammonia 0.13 mg/l and Ortho-P <0.05 mg/l. Final effluent process results on the 22/05/2025 yielded complaint results also, ammonia 0.07 mg/l and Ortho-P 0.08 mg/l. Further process testing of the final effluent on the 23/05/2025 yielded the following results; ammonia 0.05 mg/l and Ortho-P 0.065 mg/l. The plant is back fully operational since power was restored to the VSD units on the 20/05/2025 at 6pm with the overflow ceasing. There are no further issues to note since this weather event. \", \"description\": \"There was an emergency overflow from the plant on the 20/05/2025 following a lightening storm which impacted the VSD's at the the WWtP. More than 90 alarms were generated at the plant following this thunder and lightening event resulting in the VSD units loosing power. To note, there was a 'Yellow weather warning' in operation for Co. Kildare for scattered thunder storms with spot flooding and lightening damage possible. This weather warning was in effect on the 20/05/2025 from 3pm to 8pm. This EO commenced at approx. 5pm and ceased at 6pm following the restoration of power to the affected VSD units at the plant. A visual inspection of the outfall and river on the 21/05/2024 determined there was no adverse impact to note, with no clean- up required. A total volume of 1,058m3 was discharge during this event. \\r\\nAmbient sampling of the river upstream and downstream was completed on the 22/05/2025 with the following results yielded; Upstream- ammonia 0.26 mg/l and Ortho-P <0.05 mg/l. Downstream- ammonia 0.13 mg/l and Ortho-P <0.05 mg/l. Final effluent process results on the 22/05/2025 yielded complaint results also, ammonia 0.07 mg/l and Ortho-P 0.08 mg/l. Further process testing of the final effluent on the 23/05/2025 yielded the following results; ammonia 0.05 mg/l and Ortho-P 0.065 mg/l. The plant is back fully operational since power was restored to the VSD units on the 20/05/2025 at 6pm with the overflow ceasing. There are no further issues to note since this weather event. \", \"otherrelevantinformation\": \"This EO commenced at approx. 5pm and ceased at 6pm following the restoration of power to the affected VSD units at the plant. A visual inspection of the outfall and river on the 21/05/2024 determined there was no adverse impact to note, with no clean- up required. The plant is back fully operational since power was restored to the VSD units on the 20/05/2025 at 6pm with the overflow ceasing. There are no further issues to note since this weather event. \", \"impactonenvironment\": \"Ambient sampling of the river upstream and downstream was completed on the 22/05/2025 with no notable impact when comparing upstream and downstream results. The following results yielded; Upstream- ammonia 0.26 mg/l and Ortho-P <0.05 mg/l. Downstream- ammonia 0.13 mg/l and Ortho-P <0.05 mg/l. Final effluent process results on the 22/05/2025 yielded complaint results also, ammonia 0.07 mg/l and Ortho-P 0.08 mg/l. Further process testing of the final effluent on the 23/05/2025 yielded the following results; ammonia 0.05 mg/l and Ortho-P 0.065 mg/l indicating the plant is in compliance. \", \"activityinprogress\": \"Normal activities. To note, there was a 'Yellow weather warning' in operation for Co. Kildare for scattered thunder storms with spot flooding and lightening damage possible. This weather warning was in effect on the 20/05/2025 from 3pm to 8pm. \", \"dischargedetails\": \"SW2\"}"}

title: Approval to receive material as part of a trial.
metadata_json:
{"compliance_id": "980ac76d-0525-f011-a373-0050568a2d1a", "document_type": "Site Updates/Notifications", "document_url": "https://data.epa.ie/leap/api/v1/LicenseeReturns/byid?lr_id=980ac76d-0525-f011-a373-0050568a2d1a", "title": "Approval to receive material as part of a trial.  ", "description": "We refer to the approval that Galmoy Mines Ltd (GML)received from the Agency on the 6th of January 2023 to place organic waste on the TMF cap in accordance with condition 6.27 of the IPCL, subject to conditions included in the approval (ref. LR072156). The Agency was notified by GML that the trial was postponed as suitable material could not be sourced (ref. L077401).

Galmoy Mines Ltd has been approached by Shanoon Resources Ltd (SRL) who are the owners of the old Galmoy Mines production site, and licensed by the EPA under IPCL P1166, to reopen the mine. SRL have water that they wish to pump from a conditioning pond on their site. The water has some nutrient in it that would make it suitable for the trial.

There is in the order of 12,000m3 of water in the pond and the chemistry of the water is as per the table below (additional test work is under way to assess the current water chemistry).

GML is in discussion with SRL with respect to the possibility of taking this material into the TMF, but before this can occur GML would need to reaffirm that the permission granted in 2023 remains valid for a trial in 2025, subject to all if the controls that were in the proposal and the additional conditions included in the 2023 permission.

Could you confirm that the Agency is still agreeable to allowing this trial to proceed and if it is, GML will advise the Agency 72 hours before any water is taken into the TMF (subject to agreement between GML and SRL). 

regards,

Galmoy Mine. ", "submission_date": "", "status": "Closed", "metadata": "{"licenseereturnid": "980ac76d-0525-f011-a373-0050568a2d1a", "type": "Site Updates/Notifications", "reference": "LR094019", "subject": "Site Updates/Notifications:Other", "status": "Closed", "licenceid": "febfbd26-6dc1-45b8-aafc-49d7665f39b5", "licenceprofileid": "2d474abd-8042-4974-90ba-473c9d3e6ea5", "datereceived": "2025-04-29T00:00:00", "closeddate": "2025-06-24T00:00:00", "title": "Approval to receive material as part of a trial.  ", "doctype": "Site Updates/Notifications", "docsubtype": "Other", "decision": "Approved", "description": "We refer to the approval that Galmoy Mines Ltd (GML)received from the Agency on the 6th of January 2023 to place organic waste on the TMF cap in accordance with condition 6.27 of the IPCL, subject to conditions included in the approval (ref. LR072156). The Agency was notified by GML that the trial was postponed as suitable material could not be sourced (ref. L077401).\r\n\r\nGalmoy Mines Ltd has been approached by Shanoon Resources Ltd (SRL) who are the owners of the old Galmoy Mines production site, and licensed by the EPA under IPCL P1166, to reopen the mine. SRL have water that they wish to pump from a conditioning pond on their site. The water has some nutrient in it that would make it suitable for the trial.\r\n\r\nThere is in the order of 12,000m3 of water in the pond and the chemistry of the water is as per the table below (additional test work is under way to assess the current water chemistry).\r\n\r\nGML is in discussion with SRL with respect to the possibility of taking this material into the TMF, but before this can occur GML would need to reaffirm that the permission granted in 2023 remains valid for a trial in 2025, subject to all if the controls that were in the proposal and the additional conditions included in the 2023 permission.\r\n\r\nCould you confirm that the Agency is still agreeable to allowing this trial to proceed and if it is, GML will advise the Agency 72 hours before any water is taken into the TMF (subject to agreement between GML and SRL). \r\n\r\nregards,\r\n\r\nGalmoy Mine. ", "documentcategory": null, "complianceinvestigationid": null}"}

title: Response to site visit report SV29356
metadata_json:
{"compliance_id": "bb36b394-1edf-ef11-a372-0050568a2d1a", "document_type": "Site Updates/Notifications", "document_url": "https://data.epa.ie/leap/api/v1/LicenseeReturns/byid?lr_id=bb36b394-1edf-ef11-a372-0050568a2d1a", "title": "Response to site visit report SV29356", "description": "Good afternoon

The following information is provided in response to site visit report SV29356:

1) Copy of the site drawing showing the extent of the area covered by the CPO attached. Please note that the CPO process has not yet been implemented in full yet. We understand that Louth County Council has fully implemented all the steps in the CPO process for other nearby lands under the ownership of other landowners.

2) Update to planning application (reference 2460674): The outcome of the application is still pending. Louth County Council requested further information on 17th December 2024. The company is currently preparing the additional information for submission to the Council.

3) Copy of the 2024 Waste Register is attached as requested.

4) The ELRA & CRAMP for the installation will be updated in line with future activities once the outcome of the planning application is known.", "submission_date": "", "status": "Closed", "metadata": "{"licenseereturnid": "bb36b394-1edf-ef11-a372-0050568a2d1a", "type": "Site Updates/Notifications", "reference": "LR090489", "subject": "Site Updates/Notifications:Response to EPA Report", "status": "Closed", "licenceid": "ed55f5d2-4492-40af-a0bf-a520970145e0", "licenceprofileid": "e3d4cdd5-7ad0-4785-83af-614411710884", "datereceived": "2025-01-30T00:00:00", "closeddate": "2025-06-24T00:00:00", "title": "Response to site visit report SV29356", "doctype": "Site Updates/Notifications", "docsubtype": "Response to EPA Report", "decision": "Assessed", "description": "Good afternoon\r\n\r\nThe following information is provided in response to site visit report SV29356:\r\n\r\n1) Copy of the site drawing showing the extent of the area covered by the CPO attached. Please note that the CPO process has not yet been implemented in full yet. We understand that Louth County Council has fully implemented all the steps in the CPO process for other nearby lands under the ownership of other landowners.\r\n\r\n2) Update to planning application (reference 2460674): The outcome of the application is still pending. Louth County Council requested further information on 17th December 2024. The company is currently preparing the additional information for submission to the Council.\r\n\r\n3) Copy of the 2024 Waste Register is attached as requested.\r\n\r\n4) The ELRA & CRAMP for the installation will be updated in line with future activities once the outcome of the planning application is known.", "documentcategory": null, "complianceinvestigationid": null}"}

title: Request for approval to accept inert Enva ADM 19 12 12
document_type: Requests for Approval and Site Reports
metadata_json:
{"compliance_id": "10706632-bd3b-f011-a373-0050568a2d1a", "document_type": "Requests for Approval and Site Reports", "document_url": "https://data.epa.ie/leap/api/v1/LicenseeReturns/byid?lr_id=10706632-bd3b-f011-a373-0050568a2d1a", "title": "Request for approval to accept inert Enva ADM 19 12 12", "description": "Dear Mr. McCabe, 

IMS wish to request approval to accept material from the Enva/ADM farm plastic recycling plant in Lossets, Carrickmacross, Co. Monaghan. The material is soil type material which is removed from the process and is pressed as shown in the attached images. 
See below for a series of questions IMS asked of the site with corresponding answers:
1. Full company name and facility Address
Answer:
Enva Ireland Ltd.
Lossets,
Carrickmacross,
Co. Monaghan,
A81C635
2. Source site Waste Licence number and copy thereof.
Answer:
The waste facility permit number is WFP-MN-12-0001-08. See licence attached.
3. What activity and source gave rise to the material in question?
Answer:
It is sludge from an Agri plastic film washing line that has been processed through a screw press.
4. What is the original list of waste code applied to this material? I.e. What waste codes does the site accept?
Answer:
It is plastic film accepted under 02 01 04.
5. Provide an outline/description of the waste processing giving rise to the re-assigned list of waste code.
Answer:
The film is shredded down and then washed. The resulting dirt, grit, etc. is washed from the film. This process water is then treated and cleaned in a DAF waste water treatment system. The sludge taken from the DAF is processed through a screw press to dry it. This dried sludge is the waste to be removed from our site.
6. Waste haulage licence number of the proposed haulier and copy thereof.
Answer:
The haulier to be used is J Ryans.

As the material originates from a waste permitted site it has been designated code 19 12 12. The lab analysis is attached and shows the material to be inert. There is approx. 5,000 tonnes of this material generated annually. We would like to request acceptance of this We would like to request acceptance of this specifically from this source.
Best Regards,
Darren O'Reilly", "submission_date": "", "status": "Closed", "metadata": "{"licenseereturnid": "10706632-bd3b-f011-a373-0050568a2d1a", "type": "Requests for Approval and Site Reports", "reference": "LR094783", "subject": "Requests for Approval (RFA) and Site Reports:Other", "status": "Closed", "licenceid": "acc9e87d-7c61-e211-9eb5-0050568a69e2", "licenceprofileid": "6883afaf-4bda-4b0d-b76d-1808ed2cf9e9", "datereceived": "2025-05-28T00:00:00", "closeddate": "2025-06-23T00:00:00", "title": "Request for approval to accept inert Enva ADM 19 12 12", "doctype": "Requests for Approval (RFA) and Site Reports", "docsubtype": "Other", "decision": "Assessed", "description": "Dear Mr. McCabe, \r\n\r\nIMS wish to request approval to accept material from the Enva/ADM farm plastic recycling plant in Lossets, Carrickmacross, Co. Monaghan. The material is soil type material which is removed from the process and is pressed as shown in the attached images. \r\nSee below for a series of questions IMS asked of the site with corresponding answers:\r\n1. Full company name and facility Address\r\nAnswer:\r\nEnva Ireland Ltd.\r\nLossets,\r\nCarrickmacross,\r\nCo. Monaghan,\r\nA81C635\r\n2. Source site Waste Licence number and copy thereof.\r\nAnswer:\r\nThe waste facility permit number is WFP-MN-12-0001-08. See licence attached.\r\n3. What activity and source gave rise to the material in question?\r\nAnswer:\r\nIt is sludge from an Agri plastic film washing line that has been processed through a screw press.\r\n4. title: P0011-06 F-Gas Removals from Site after Equipment Maintenance in 2024
metadata_json:
{"compliance_id": "9955d5ed-0316-f011-a373-0050568a2d1a", "document_type": "Site Updates/Notifications", "document_url": "https://data.epa.ie/leap/api/v1/LicenseeReturns/byid?lr_id=9955d5ed-0316-f011-a373-0050568a2d1a", "title": "P0011-06 F-Gas Removals from Site after Equipment Maintenance in 2024", "description": "Dear Ms. McMullen,  
  
As required for our response to the Agency survey, ODS and F-Gas Questionnaire for EPA Licenced Facilities EPA043409 received on 11th March 2025, please find the enclosed details of F-Gas refrigerant removals from site by the refrigerant contractor after equipment maintenance / decommissioning activities at the MSD Ireland (Ballydine) facility during 2024.  
  
Please see enclosed summary table, with the requested details for the quantities of F-Gas refrigerant that were removed from site for destruction by technicians working for the refrigerant contractor, CTS (Cross Technical Solutions).  
  
The F-Gas refrigerant removals arose after replacement of an A/C unit (2.75 kg R410A) and following decommissioning of two F-Gas process chillers (1,184 kg R507).  These two F-Gas process chillers have been replaced by Ammonia process chillers.  This F-Gas waste was transferred by CTS to Fridge Spares Wholesale Ltd. and RSL Ireland Ltd. respectively for storage prior to shipment for destruction.  This F-Gas waste currently remains at these storage facilities and is expected to be shipped for destruction in the coming weeks.  
  
Please let us know should any additional information be required.  
  
Yours sincerely,  
  
David O’Gorman  
Sr Specialist, Safety & Environment   ", "submission_date": "", "status": "Closed", "metadata": "{"licenseereturnid": "9955d5ed-0316-f011-a373-0050568a2d1a", "type": "Site Updates/Notifications", "reference": "LR093340", "subject": "Site Updates/Notifications:Other", "status": "Closed", "licenceid": "27f2f1d0-6fa5-404b-b8f0-79c6213e09de", "licenceprofileid": "78c80169-1164-478f-8852-2e93e44eb406", "datereceived": "2025-04-10T00:00:00", "closeddate": "2025-06-23T00:00:00", "title": "P0011-06 F-Gas Removals from Site after Equipment Maintenance in 2024", "doctype": "Site Updates/Notifications", "docsubtype": "Other", "decision": "Assessed", "description": "Dear Ms. McMullen,  \r\n  \r\nAs required for our response to the Agency survey, ODS and F-Gas Questionnaire for EPA Licenced Facilities EPA043409 received on 11th March 2025, please find the enclosed details of F-Gas refrigerant removals from site by the refrigerant contractor after equipment maintenance / decommissioning activities at the MSD Ireland (Ballydine) facility during 2024.  \r\n  \r\nPlease see enclosed summary table, with the requested details for the quantities of F-Gas refrigerant that were removed from site for destruction by technicians working for the refrigerant contractor, CTS (Cross Technical Solutions).  \r\n  \r\nThe F-Gas refrigerant removals arose after replacement of an A/C unit (2.75 kg R410A) and following decommissioning of two F-Gas process chillers (1,184 kg R507).  These two F-Gas process chillers have been replaced by Ammonia process chillers.  This F-Gas waste was transferred by CTS to Fridge Spares Wholesale Ltd. and RSL Ireland Ltd. respectively for storage prior to shipment for destruction.  This F-Gas waste currently remains at these storage facilities and is expected to be shipped for destruction in the coming weeks.  \r\n  \r\nPlease let us know should any additional information be required.  \r\n  \r\nYours sincerely,  \r\n  \r\nDavid O\u2019Gorman  \r\nSr Specialist, Safety & Environment   ", "documentcategory": null, "complianceinvestigationid": null}"}

title: Data and FI requested during reactive SV
metadata_json:
{"compliance_id": "ab709a1b-4819-f011-a373-0050568a2d1a", "document_type": "Site Updates/Notifications", "document_url": "https://data.epa.ie/leap/api/v1/LicenseeReturns/byid?lr_id=ab709a1b-4819-f011-a373-0050568a2d1a", "title": "Data and FI requested during reactive SV ", "description": "Dear Inspector,
please see below as discussed on site on 03/04/2025:
-	Flow data into and out of the PS from 21/03/2025 – 24/03/2024 from SCADA to show before power outage and after scenario 
The average pumped flow-rate from Ratoath PS from 22/03/2025 to 25/03/2025 was 52m3/hour – see attached within data file.
-	Basis for estimation of approx. 2500m3 volume from the SWO 
The initial estimation was based on the flows in the downstream pumping station at Kilbride. This however also included flows from Ashbourne PS. Based on the average pumped flow-rate figure above, it is estimated that the total daily flow would be 1400m3. Following the pumps failure the storm tank was at high level for 21hours from 13:00 on 23/03/2025 to 10:00 on 24/03/2025. Based on this it is estimated that as a worst case scenario a maximum of 1092m3 overflowed during the incident. However, as this estimate is based on the pumps running constantly the volume overflowed is likely to be less than this. The weather at the time of the incident was dry so the pumps were likely to have been on and off during the day.
-	Flow data from the meter on the outlet pipe for 12 months 
See attached average daily flow rates of pumped flow from Ratoath PS.
-	Volume of the onsite storm water tank
The storm tanks have a capacity of approximately 1700m3.
-	What was the outcome when the electricians investigated the UPS failure – unit has been replaced and operating correctly 
Meath WSA are awaiting final report on investigations from electrical contractors.

Following the uncontrolled release at Ratoath PS ambient samples were taken upstream and downstream of the pump station on 03/04/2025 (sample locations attached).
An assessment of the results show there was no negative impact on the downstream location. 
See also attached monitoring data results from the Ratoath/Broadmeadow river at locations monitored as part o", "submission_date": "", "status": "Closed", "metadata": "{"licenseereturnid": "ab709a1b-4819-f011-a373-0050568a2d1a", "type": "Site Updates/Notifications", "reference": "LR093580", "subject": "Site Updates/Notifications:Response to EPA Report", "status": "Closed", "licenceid": "4ab24fc5-2bf8-4aa8-ad9e-f4f68c559186", "licenceprofileid": "188b6e9c-77a4-4dd9-895c-17080f6af298", "datereceived": "2025-04-14T00:00:00", "closeddate": "2025-06-23T00:00:00", "title": "Data and FI requested during reactive SV ", "doctype": "Site Updates/Notifications", "docsubtype": "Response to EPA Report", "decision": "Assessed", "description": "Dear Inspector,\r\nplease see below as discussed on site on 03/04/2025:\r\n-\tFlow data into and out of the PS from 21/03/2025 \u2013 24/03/2024 from SCADA to show before power outage and after scenario \r\nThe average pumped flow-rate from Ratoath PS from 22/03/2025 to 25/03/2025 was 52m3/hour \u2013 see attached within data file.\r\n-\tBasis for estimation of approx. 2500m3 volume from the SWO \r\nThe initial estimation was based on the flows in the downstream pumping station at Kilbride. This however also included flows from Ashbourne PS. Based on the average pumped flow-rate figure above, it is estimated that the total daily flow would be 1400m3. Following the pumps failure the storm tank was at high level for 21hours from 13:00 on 23/03/2025 to 10:00 on 24/03/2025. Based on this it is estimated that as a worst case scenario a maximum of 1092m3 overflowed during the incident. However, as this estimate is based on the pumps running constantly the volume overflowed is likely to be less than this. The weather at the time of the incident was dry so the pumps were likely to have been on and off during the day.\r\n-\tFlow data from the meter on the outlet pipe for 12 months \r\nSee attached average daily flow rates of pumped flow from Ratoath PS.\r\n-\tVolume of the onsite storm water tank\r\nThe storm tanks have a capacity of approximately 1700m3.\r\n-\tWhat was the outcome when the electricians investigated the UPS failure \u2013 unit has been replaced and operating correctly \r\nMeath WSA are awaiting final report on investigations from electrical contractors.\r\n\r\nFollowing the uncontrolled release at Ratoath PS ambient samples were taken upstream and downstream of the pump station on 03/04/2025 (sample locations attached).\r\nAn assessment of the results show there was no negative impact on the downstream location. \r\nSee also attached monitoring data results from the Ratoath/Broadmeadow river at locations monitored as part o", "documentcategory": null, "complianceinvestigationid": null}"}

These adverse weather conditions and the associated winds from the east, led to some dust lifting from a part of the BRDA surface, which is a highly unusual occurrence. Following this observation, AAL staff conducted off-site visual surveys downwind of the site, however nothing was observed during these checks. Operations at the plant site and the BRDA were normal at the time.

A check of the AAL Osiris online continuous particulate monitors showed an elevated reading for total particulates at the Foynes monitoring unit, west of the site, which was short lived and dissipated quickly back to normal background levels. It is noted that the other on and off-site Osiris monitors at the same time did not show similar elevated readings.
 
This Osiris at Foynes is approximately 3km from AAL and there was no evidence of material from the BRDA deposited at this Osiris location. Therefore, it cannot be confirmed if these elevated levels were as a result of what was observed on site, or if it may have been attributed to general dusting from other areas due to the weather conditions prevailing at the time. 

As part of the immediate checks it was confirmed that the BRDA sprinkling system was in operation as normal throughout the day, and in the preceding days and weeks, and this continues to be the case. In addition, further action was taken subsequent to the on-site observation, where sprinkling was kept on throughout the night. title: Site Visit Reference No. SV31772
metadata_json:
{"compliance_id": "314e12f6-113b-f011-a373-0050568a2d1a", "document_type": "Site Updates/Notifications", "document_url": "https://data.epa.ie/leap/api/v1/LicenseeReturns/byid?lr_id=314e12f6-113b-f011-a373-0050568a2d1a", "title": "Site Visit Reference No. SV31772", "description": "To whom it may concern,

Based on the latest on-site visit with reference number SV31772, you will find the following information attached as part of our compliance.

1.Clarochem Groundwater Monitoring Q4 2024 and Q1 2025 Results.

2.Quotation for last year and final cost tally showing interceptor works completed. This cost tally also shows the volume removed from site from the interceptor.
Interceptor: This point represents the last point to take a sample before the system discharges into the river. From this interceptor, the water flows to an underground sump where the pH is constantly monitored and recorded.   When the pH is within the limits, water flows into the nearby river. If the pH goes out of this range, a valve to the river automatically closes and an alarm in the security hut is activated. Water from this sump can be pumped to the WWTP, where it can be treated before discharge.

3.Retention Drains:
-These drainage channels lead directly to our neutralisation tank, which has a capacity of 10.2 m3. This is pumped to one of our holding tanks of 50m 3 each.
-The last deep cleaning was in January 2025.
-A restructuring of the retention drains, where materials are issued, returns and waste, is planned. In process of internal review.

4.Update of the Site Plan, Foul, Process Drains
All our process waste from the synthesis plant, finishing plant and the labs goes to T13 (Neutralising Tank) and then to HT-1 & HT-2 (Holding Tanks) prior to release to the on-site foul sewer via F3. This then leads via F4 & F5 to the emission point WW-D1 (public foul sewer -not the river) on the southern boundary of the site.  As shown in the blue line on the plan.

Should you require additional information please do not hesitate to contact us.

Kind Regards.
Guillermo Vega 
", "submission_date": "", "status": "Closed", "metadata": "{"licenseereturnid": "314e12f6-113b-f011-a373-0050568a2d1a", "type": "Site Updates/Notifications", "reference": "LR094738", "subject": "Site Updates/Notifications:Other", "status": "Closed", "licenceid": "b8c5e87d-7c61-e211-9eb5-0050568a69e2", "licenceprofileid": "582c502f-08c7-4351-8a3e-f35bf25777c1", "datereceived": "2025-05-27T00:00:00", "closeddate": "2025-06-20T00:00:00", "title": "Site Visit Reference No. SV31772", "doctype": "Site Updates/Notifications", "docsubtype": "Other", "decision": "Assessed", "description": "To whom it may concern,\r\n\r\nBased on the latest on-site visit with reference number SV31772, you will find the following information attached as part of our compliance.\r\n\r\n1.Clarochem Groundwater Monitoring Q4 2024 and Q1 2025 Results.\r\n\r\n2.Quotation for last year and final cost tally showing interceptor works completed. This cost tally also shows the volume removed from site from the interceptor.\r\nInterceptor: This point represents the last point to take a sample before the system discharges into the river. From this interceptor, the water flows to an underground sump where the pH is constantly monitored and recorded.   When the pH is within the limits, water flows into the nearby river. If the pH goes out of this range, a valve to the river automatically closes and an alarm in the security hut is activated. Water from this sump can be pumped to the WWTP, where it can be treated before discharge.\r\n\r\n3.Retention Drains:\r\n-These drainage channels lead directly to our neutralisation tank, which has a capacity of 10.2 m3. This is pumped to one of our holding tanks of 50m 3 each.\r\n-The last deep cleaning was in January 2025.\r\n-A restructuring of the retention drains, where materials are issued, returns and waste, is planned. In process of internal review.\r\n\r\n4.Update of the Site Plan, Foul, Process Drains\r\nAll our process waste from the synthesis plant, finishing plant and the labs goes to T13 (Neutralising Tank) and then to HT-1 & HT-2 (Holding Tanks) prior to release to the on-site foul sewer via F3. This then leads via F4 & F5 to the emission point WW-D1 (public foul sewer -not the river) on the southern boundary of the site.  As shown in the blue line on the plan.\r\n\r\nShould you require additional information please do not hesitate to contact us.\r\n\r\nKind Regards.\r\nGuillermo Vega \r\n", "documentcategory": null, "complianceinvestigationid": null}"}

title: Commencement of expansion to site attenuation pond.
document_type: Requests for Approval and Site Reports
metadata_json:
{"compliance_id": "c6e0654a-a825-f011-a373-0050568a2d1a", "document_type": "Requests for Approval and Site Reports", "document_url": "https://data.epa.ie/leap/api/v1/LicenseeReturns/byid?lr_id=c6e0654a-a825-f011-a373-0050568a2d1a", "title": "Commencement of expansion to site attenuation pond.", "description": "Dear Madam,

In accordance with EPA guidance document entitled “Guidance on Requests for Alterations to a Licensed Industrial or Waste Activity” June 2019, and Condition 1 of P1030-01, we wish to inform the Agency of minor alternation to our site, which can be accommodated & controlled under the existing conditions and limits set out in the forementioned licence.
This change is to request the commencement of construction activities to expand the site attenuation pond to accommodate site infrastructure expansion, in line with what has been included in our planning application, IEL Review Application [LA011910] and Revised Firewater Retention Risk Assessment [LR086943] submitted 09 Aug 2024.
Please find the details attached. Don't hesitate to contact me should you have any queries.

Regards.
Adrien Hogan", "submission_date": "", "status": "Closed", "metadata": "{"licenseereturnid": "c6e0654a-a825-f011-a373-0050568a2d1a", "type": "Requests for Approval and Site Reports", "reference": "LR094048", "subject": "Requests for Approval (RFA) and Site Reports:Condition 1 changes", "status": "Closed", "licenceid": "93e1da02-6a38-e611-99f8-0050568a69e2", "licenceprofileid": "f89123ac-6738-e611-99f8-0050568a69e2", "datereceived": "2025-04-30T00:00:00", "closeddate": "2025-06-19T00:00:00", "title": "Commencement of expansion to site attenuation pond.", "doctype": "Requests for Approval (RFA) and Site Reports", "docsubtype": "Condition 1 changes", "decision": "Approved", "description": "Dear Madam,\r\n\r\nIn accordance with EPA guidance document entitled \u201cGuidance on Requests for Alterations to a Licensed Industrial or Waste Activity\u201d June 2019, and Condition 1 of P1030-01, we wish to inform the Agency of minor alternation to our site, which can be accommodated & controlled under the existing conditions and limits set out in the forementioned licence.\r\nThis change is to request the commencement of construction activities to expand the site attenuation pond to accommodate site infrastructure expansion, in line with what has been included in our planning application, IEL Review Application [LA011910] and Revised Firewater Retention Risk Assessment [LR086943] submitted 09 Aug 2024.\r\nPlease find the details attached. Don't hesitate to contact me should you have any queries.\r\n\r\nRegards.\r\nAdrien Hogan", "documentcategory": "Other", "complianceinvestigationid": null}"}

title: Diesel Range Organics
metadata_json:
{"compliance_id": "5fbf0f2c-7132-f011-a373-0050568a2d1a", "document_type": "Site Updates/Notifications", "document_url": "https://data.epa.ie/leap/api/v1/LicenseeReturns/byid?lr_id=5fbf0f2c-7132-f011-a373-0050568a2d1a", "title": "Diesel Range Organics", "description": "Dear Krzysztof,

I apologise for the confusion but I would appreciate some clarification please. The lab (Element Materials Technologies Ltd) has advised that DRO is a vague term and that they require clarification. I understand from the lab that what they would have previously called DRO, they now call EPH (which is part of our sampling regime). The lab has requested if the EPA mean EPH and if so what banding they require? If the EPA can confirm the banding, I am hopeful that the lab can provide the relevant results, even retrospectively for 2024. 

I appreciate any guidance that you can provide on this issue.

Kind regards,
Toddy.", "submission_date": "", "status": "Closed", "metadata": "{"licenseereturnid": "5fbf0f2c-7132-f011-a373-0050568a2d1a", "type": "Site Updates/Notifications", "reference": "LR094489", "subject": "Site Updates/Notifications:Other", "status": "Closed", "licenceid": "0975138a-d254-e611-9a04-0050568a69e2", "licenceprofileid": "77385efd-ce54-e611-9a04-0050568a69e2", "datereceived": "2025-05-16T00:00:00", "closeddate": "2025-06-18T00:00:00", "title": "Diesel Range Organics", "doctype": "Site Updates/Notifications", "docsubtype": "Other", "decision": "Assessed", "description": "Dear Krzysztof,\r\n\r\nI apologise for the confusion but I would appreciate some clarification please. The lab (Element Materials Technologies Ltd) has advised that DRO is a vague term and that they require clarification. I understand from the lab that what they would have previously called DRO, they now call EPH (which is part of our sampling regime). The lab has requested if the EPA mean EPH and if so what banding they require? If the EPA can confirm the banding, I am hopeful that the lab can provide the relevant results, even retrospectively for 2024. \r\n\r\nI appreciate any guidance that you can provide on this issue.\r\n\r\nKind regards,\r\nToddy.", "documentcategory": null, "complianceinvestigationid": null}"}

{"compliance_id": "64ea0429-5f35-f011-a373-0050568a2d1a", "document_type": "Incident", "document_url": "https://data.epa.ie/leap/api/v1/Incident/byid?incident_id=64ea0429-5f35-f011-a373-0050568a2d1a", "title": "", "description": "Condensate dripping from inside composting sheds cladding to external ground", "submission_date": "", "status": "Closed", "metadata": "{\"incidentid\": \"64ea0429-5f35-f011-a373-0050568a2d1a\", \"type\": \"Incident\", \"reference\": \"INCI030347\", \"subject\": \"Uncontrolled Release\", \"status\": \"Closed\", \"licenceid\": \"1a913829-0e4d-46c7-9e31-cd73ba4082d0\", \"licenceprofileid\": \"fe25a7be-b6b1-4353-a8b8-5d5ce20c15dd\", \"complianceinvestigationid\": null, \"incidentcategory\": \"2. Limited\", \"nature\": \"Uncontrolled Release\", \"vulnerablereceptors\": \"Groundwater\", \"receptors\": \"Ground\", \"likelihoodofreoccurence\": \"Low\", \"likelycause\": \"Damage to sloped sheeting above bay walls allowed for condensate from inside the sheds to drip down teh iside of the shed walls and to drip onto the ground at the base of the shed wall.\", \"newrecurring\": \"New\", \"datenotified\": \"2025-05-20T00:00:00\", \"closeddate\": \"2025-06-16T00:00:00\", \"approximatestart\": \"2025-03-14T09:00:00\", \"firstnoticed\": \"2025-03-14T09:00:00\", \"finishtime\": \"2025-05-01T08:00:00\", \"notifiedparties\": \"\", \"dischargepoint\": \"No\", \"emissionpointname\": \"n/a\", \"uncontrolledrelease\": \"Condensate leachate from maturing organic material\", \"description\": \"Condensate dripping from inside composting sheds cladding to external ground\", \"otherrelevantinformation\": \"With the volume of construction works beng completed throughout teh country it can be difficult to get contractors in to complete works on site.  The sloped sheeting repairs will be completed as soon as a contractor can be employed to complete the works. \", \"impactonenvironment\": \"Unknown, potential impact on groundwater\", \"activityinprogress\": \"Normal Comosting Activities were taking place\", \"dischargedetails\": \"Condensate dripped down the wall cladding at the rear (east) of sheds 2 and 3 at various locations where sloped sheeting inside teh shed were damaged.\"}"}

{"compliance_id": "af06d6c6-db3b-f011-a373-0050568a2d1a", "document_type": "Incident", "document_url": "https://data.epa.ie/leap/api/v1/Incident/byid?incident_id=af06d6c6-db3b-f011-a373-0050568a2d1a", "title": "", "description": "Following a series of elevated COD concentrations entering the WWTP system over the course of the last few weeks, the clarifier settling has disimproved drastically. COD results for the outlet (DP001) on site have been gradually increasing as the system struggles to effectively treat the incoming loadings. Yesterday, 27th of May, the outlet sample results returned with a COD at 1200 mg/l and a SS concentration of 1020 mg/l. Today, 28th of May, the outlet sample results have returned with a COD of 1064 mg/l and SS at 940 mg/l. The corresponding COD loading was 157 kg on the 27th and 182 kg on the 28th. The SS loading was 133 kg on the 27th and 148 kg on the 28th. Since yesterday, every effort is being taken to resume the settlement in the clarifier.", "submission_date": "", "status": "Closed", "metadata": "{\"incidentid\": \"af06d6c6-db3b-f011-a373-0050568a2d1a\", \"type\": \"Incident\", \"reference\": \"INCI030402\", \"subject\": \"Breach of ELV\", \"status\": \"Closed\", \"licenceid\": \"4ec5e87d-7c61-e211-9eb5-0050568a69e2\", \"licenceprofileid\": \"177d9576-1c1f-4a4e-98b7-7babe9cdf8b2\", \"complianceinvestigationid\": null, \"incidentcategory\": \"1. Minor\", \"nature\": \"Breach of ELV\", \"vulnerablereceptors\": \"N/A as WW outfall flows to Carrigrennan for further treatment.\", \"receptors\": \"Sewer\", \"likelihoodofreoccurence\": \"High\", \"likelycause\": \"Shock load to the WWTP\", \"newrecurring\": \"Recurring\", \"datenotified\": \"2025-05-28T00:00:00\", \"closeddate\": \"2025-06-16T00:00:00\", \"approximatestart\": \"2025-05-27T08:00:00\", \"firstnoticed\": \"2025-05-27T08:00:00\", \"finishtime\": \"2025-06-06T08:00:00\", \"notifiedparties\": \"\", \"dischargepoint\": \"Yes\", \"emissionpointname\": \"P0017-DP 001\", \"uncontrolledrelease\": \"n/a\", \"description\": \"Following a series of elevated COD concentrations entering the WWTP system over the course of the last few weeks, the clarifier settling has disimproved drastically. COD results for the outlet (DP001) on site have been gradually increasing as the system struggles to effectively treat the incoming loadings. Yesterday, 27th of May, the outlet sample results returned with a COD at 1200 mg/l and a SS concentration of 1020 mg/l. Today, 28th of May, the outlet sample results have returned with a COD of 1064 mg/l and SS at 940 mg/l. The corresponding COD loading was 157 kg on the 27th and 182 kg on the 28th. The SS loading was 133 kg on the 27th and 148 kg on the 28th. Since yesterday, every effort is being taken to resume the settlement in the clarifier.\", \"otherrelevantinformation\": \"Irish water has been informed of these exceedances by email.\", \"impactonenvironment\": \"The effects of this incident on the environment are minimal as the outfall at DP001 travels for further treatment at Carrigrennan WWTP. \\r\\nOn 29th of May, results have come back OOS for COD however SS are at 504 mg/l. Results show that COD and SS for the outlet are trending downwards.\\r\\nAs of Friday 6th of June, settlement has resumed in the clarifier and additional dewatering has resulted in outlet samples being within specification of ELVs. All results from the 29th of May onward have been within the licensed ELVs.\", \"activityinprogress\": \"Normal operations were occurring at time of incident. Since the incident, flows to the wastewater have been limited. Settlement tests are being conducted to assess what additives will help resume flocculation and settling. The high COD loadings are still working their way through the system and due to this it is likely that we will have more OOS results in the coming days. \", \"dischargedetails\": null}"}

title: Request for Time Extension - Report
metadata_json:
{"compliance_id": "24146e0c-ad3b-f011-a373-0050568a2d1a", "document_type": "Site Updates/Notifications", "document_url": "https://data.epa.ie/leap/api/v1/LicenseeReturns/byid?lr_id=24146e0c-ad3b-f011-a373-0050568a2d1a", "title": "Request for Time Extension - Report ", "description": "Dear Ellen Brogan, 

As part of Site Visit Report SV31819, Section 4.3 requested that Bord na Mona Recycling Ltd submit a report detailing the findings of the below, as a  licensee return via EDEN within two months of the date of issue of this report :

1. review the groundwater monitoring results and confirm if natural attenuation is occurring; and
2. conduct trend analysis for groundwater monitoring results and include a projection as to when Groundwater Threshold Values are likely to be met for all parameters.

Our consultant has requested additional time to complete this report and has provided us with a date of 30th July 2025 for completion -  as they as currently working during a very busy period. 

Kind Regards, 
Mary Bannon
Environmental Officer
087 6846448


", "submission_date": "", "status": "Closed", "metadata": "{"licenseereturnid": "24146e0c-ad3b-f011-a373-0050568a2d1a", "type": "Site Updates/Notifications", "reference": "LR094769", "subject": "Site Updates/Notifications:Other", "status": "Closed", "licenceid": "1ccae87d-7c61-e211-9eb5-0050568a69e2", "licenceprofileid": "db967645-e5c5-438f-9cb5-7bcf91287c66", "datereceived": "2025-05-28T00:00:00", "closeddate": "2025-06-12T00:00:00", "title": "Request for Time Extension - Report ", "doctype": "Site Updates/Notifications", "docsubtype": "Other", "decision": "Assessed", "description": "Dear Ellen Brogan, \r\n\r\nAs part of Site Visit Report SV31819, Section 4.3 requested that Bord na Mona Recycling Ltd submit a report detailing the findings of the below, as a  licensee return via EDEN within two months of the date of issue of this report :\r\n\r\n1. review the groundwater monitoring results and confirm if natural attenuation is occurring; and\r\n2. conduct trend analysis for groundwater monitoring results and include a projection as to when Groundwater Threshold Values are likely to be met for all parameters.\r\n\r\nOur consultant has requested additional time to complete this report and has provided us with a date of 30th July 2025 for completion -  as they as currently working during a very busy period. \r\n\r\nKind Regards, \r\nMary Bannon\r\nEnvironmental Officer\r\n087 6846448\r\n\r\n\r\n", "documentcategory": null, "complianceinvestigationid": null}"}

{"compliance_id": "afa98c4c-3f36-f011-a373-0050568a2d1a", "document_type": "Monitoring Returns", "document_url": "https://data.epa.ie/leap/api/v1/LicenseeReturns/byid?lr_id=afa98c4c-3f36-f011-a373-0050568a2d1a", "title": "Noise Monitoring ", "description": "Please find attached the noise monitoring report for the Safety Kleen site. The findings conclude that the site is not currently generating a nuisance.

From our records, it appears that previous noise monitoring submissions on Eden (26th of March 2025) were carried out by a third party, Panther Environmental. I have attempted to contact Jason Carroll to confirm this.  I am now resubmitting as I cannot see this record.  

Regarding air and water monitoring, the assessments have been completed; however, we are currently awaiting the release of the reports from the third-party provider. These will be uploaded to the system as soon as they become available.

Please let me know if you require any further information.", "submission_date": "", "status": "Closed", "metadata": "{"licenseereturnid": "afa98c4c-3f36-f011-a373-0050568a2d1a", "type": "Monitoring Returns", "reference": "LR094572", "subject": "Monitoring Returns:Noise", "status": "Closed", "licenceid": "98c9e87d-7c61-e211-9eb5-0050568a69e2", "licenceprofileid": "d94dcd25-521d-4632-b0db-dac2043d51cd", "datereceived": "2025-05-21T00:00:00", "closeddate": "2025-06-11T00:00:00", "title": "Noise Monitoring ", "doctype": "Monitoring Returns", "docsubtype": "Noise", "decision": "Assessed", "description": "Please find attached the noise monitoring report for the Safety Kleen site. The findings conclude that the site is not currently generating a nuisance.\r\n\r\nFrom our records, it appears that previous noise monitoring submissions on Eden (26th of March 2025) were carried out by a third party, Panther Environmental. I have attempted to contact Jason Carroll to confirm this.  I am now resubmitting as I cannot see this record.  \r\n\r\nRegarding air and water monitoring, the assessments have been completed; however, we are currently awaiting the release of the reports from the third-party provider. These will be uploaded to the system as soon as they become available.\r\n\r\nPlease let me know if you require any further information.", "documentcategory": "Compliant", "complianceinvestigationid": null}"}

title: Request for Approval - Fuel storage associated with the Fire Water Suppression System
document_type: Requests for Approval and Site Reports
metadata_json:
{"compliance_id": "f436a435-a63b-f011-a373-0050568a2d1a", "document_type": "Requests for Approval and Site Reports", "document_url": "https://data.epa.ie/leap/api/v1/LicenseeReturns/byid?lr_id=f436a435-a63b-f011-a373-0050568a2d1a", "title": "Request for Approval - Fuel storage associated with the Fire Water Suppression System ", "description": " 
Dear Ellen Brogan,


In accordance with Condition 1.5 of Licence W0222-01 and as requested in SV31819 Bord na Mona Recycling Ltd are upgrading the Fire Water Suppression system at the Lusk Facility. 

With this Bord na Mona Recycling Ltd request approval for the additional fuel storage which will be required as per the technical specifications attached.  

If you require any further information please don’t hesitate to contact me. 

Kind Regards, 
Mary Bannon. 
—
Mary Bannon
Environmental Compliance Officer
—
+353 87 6846448
bordnamona.ie

{"compliance_id": "08835ea4-e23b-f011-a373-0050568a2d1a", "document_type": "Incident", "document_url": "https://data.epa.ie/leap/api/v1/Incident/byid?incident_id=08835ea4-e23b-f011-a373-0050568a2d1a", "title": "", "description": "Notification for a comms issue on block 7 at Ringsend WWTP on 25/05/2025. A faulty remote I/O drop adapter on PLC #2 for block 7 & 8 was intermittently causing faults resulting in reduced aeration treatment on block 7. Flows were low at the time. The faulty I/O module was replaced with a in stock spare on 25/05/2025, once it had been identified and treatment returned to normal. There are two additional units now on order. The cause is most likely due to random failure of an electronic component and this may point to a problem with the redundancy in the comms for block 7 & 8 which operators are to investigate. \r\nThere are two additional units now on order.", "submission_date": "", "status": "Closed", "metadata": "{\"incidentid\": \"08835ea4-e23b-f011-a373-0050568a2d1a\", \"type\": \"Incident\", \"reference\": \"INCI030405\", \"subject\": \"Abatement equipment off-line\", \"status\": \"Closed\", \"licenceid\": \"4ab24fc5-2bf8-4aa8-ad9e-f4f68c559186\", \"licenceprofileid\": \"188b6e9c-77a4-4dd9-895c-17080f6af298\", \"complianceinvestigationid\": null, \"incidentcategory\": \"1. Minor\", \"nature\": \"Abatement equipment off-line\", \"vulnerablereceptors\": \"No uncontrolled release\", \"receptors\": \"No uncontrolled release\", \"likelihoodofreoccurence\": \"Low\", \"likelycause\": \"Plant or equipment breakdown at WWTP\", \"newrecurring\": \"New\", \"datenotified\": \"2025-05-28T00:00:00\", \"closeddate\": \"2025-06-04T00:00:00\", \"approximatestart\": \"2025-05-25T11:15:00\", \"firstnoticed\": \"2025-05-25T11:15:00\", \"finishtime\": \"2025-05-26T10:00:00\", \"notifiedparties\": \"Inland Fisheries Ireland\", \"dischargepoint\": \"No\", \"emissionpointname\": \"n/a\", \"uncontrolledrelease\": \"n/a\", \"description\": \"Notification for a comms issue on block 7 at Ringsend WWTP on 25/05/2025. A faulty remote I/O drop adapter on PLC #2 for block 7 & 8 was intermittently causing faults resulting in reduced aeration treatment on block 7. Flows were low at the time. The faulty I/O module was replaced with a in stock spare on 25/05/2025, once it had been identified and treatment returned to normal. There are two additional units now on order. The cause is most likely due to random failure of an electronic component and this may point to a problem with the redundancy in the comms for block 7 & 8 which operators are to investigate. \\r\\nThere are two additional units now on order.\", \"otherrelevantinformation\": null, \"impactonenvironment\": \"No impact as there was no uncontrolled release.\", \"activityinprogress\": \"Normal Activities\", \"dischargedetails\": \"PLC #2 for block 7 & 8\"}"}

{"compliance_id": "3ee0d7c2-0437-f011-a373-0050568a2d1a", "document_type": "Incident", "document_url": "https://data.epa.ie/leap/api/v1/Incident/byid?incident_id=3ee0d7c2-0437-f011-a373-0050568a2d1a", "title": "", "description": "There was an intermittent overflow at Bedford Row, Aston Quay, Dublin 2, over the course of approximately 5 days starting 07/04/2025 (see photo attached). U\u00c9 were notified of the incident on 07/04/2025 and U\u00c9 wastewater network crews investigated and monitored the overflow over the course of a number of days. The overflow was found to be intermittent. Confined space entry was required to remove grease and rags which had caused had caused flaps to get stuck open. Bedford Row pit and flaps in overflow manholes cleaned out early morning on Sunday 13/04/2025 at a time when the tide and traffic levels were low enough to allow this work to be undertaken. {"compliance_id": "94ea3404-2336-f011-a373-0050568a2d1a", "document_type": "Incident", "document_url": "https://data.epa.ie/leap/api/v1/Incident/byid?incident_id=94ea3404-2336-f011-a373-0050568a2d1a", "title": "", "description": "Issues with RBC cutting out over night at Emyvale WWTP. metadata_json:
{"compliance_id": "1ddc1e1c-e23b-f011-a373-0050568a2d1a", "document_type": "Site Updates/Notifications", "document_url": "https://data.epa.ie/leap/api/v1/LicenseeReturns/byid?lr_id=1ddc1e1c-e23b-f011-a373-0050568a2d1a", "title": "Correction update to LR094663 ", "description": "Niamh/Caroline
Correction to point number 6 as per LR094663 relating to carrying an odour impact assessment every 3 years – this should read as follows:
6.	Odour Impact Assessment every 3 years 6.14.4 – Denis had said on the day that this was done, however he had it mixed up with the 2023 odour Management Plan. But the odour assessments completed by the odour consultant company Katestsone in 2023 and 2024 comprise an odour impact assessment and that all these reports were uploaded in EDEN as requested by the EPA and all the recommendations arising from these have been implemented.

Regards
Denis

title: P0698-01 Honeywell - AEMP batch scheduling
metadata_json:
{"compliance_id": "017fe088-d73b-f011-a373-0050568a2d1a", "document_type": "Site Updates/Notifications", "document_url": "https://data.epa.ie/leap/api/v1/LicenseeReturns/byid?lr_id=017fe088-d73b-f011-a373-0050568a2d1a", "title": "P0698-01 Honeywell - AEMP batch scheduling", "description": "Dear Martina,

Further to our phone conversation today please be advised the following production areas, and the air emission points associated with them, are scheduled to run uninterrupted up to the Annual Shutdown planned to begin on Monday, 28th July 2025:

Root Coat - Extractor - A2-1 to A2-3 (TOC, Antimony, Lead),
Cleanline - Scrubber - A2-9 (Fluorine[HF], Nitric Acid[HNO3], Sulphuric Acid[H2SO4]),
Forge - Scrubber - A2-11 (Particulates, Nickel, Iron, Titanium).

Our preference would be for the air emission monitoring team to carry out the air monitoring between 8:00am and 4:00pm, however the operations run on the two shifts rota: 6:00am to 2:00pm and 2:00pm to 10:00pm.
If you have any more queries, please feel free to contact me.

Kind Regards,
Bart Zdrojowy
HSE Site Lead", "submission_date": "", "status": "Closed", "metadata": "{"licenseereturnid": "017fe088-d73b-f011-a373-0050568a2d1a", "type": "Site Updates/Notifications", "reference": "LR094796", "subject": "Site Updates/Notifications:Other", "status": "Closed", "licenceid": "cec7e87d-7c61-e211-9eb5-0050568a69e2", "licenceprofileid": "07d94887-aa7a-4a91-93a6-f414d2364fbb", "datereceived": "2025-05-28T00:00:00", "closeddate": "2025-05-30T00:00:00", "title": "P0698-01 Honeywell - AEMP batch scheduling", "doctype": "Site Updates/Notifications", "docsubtype": "Other", "decision": "Assessed", "description": "Dear Martina,\r\n\r\nFurther to our phone conversation today please be advised the following production areas, and the air emission points associated with them, are scheduled to run uninterrupted up to the Annual Shutdown planned to begin on Monday, 28th July 2025:\r\n\r\nRoot Coat - Extractor - A2-1 to A2-3 (TOC, Antimony, Lead),\r\nCleanline - Scrubber - A2-9 (Fluorine[HF], Nitric Acid[HNO3], Sulphuric Acid[H2SO4]),\r\nForge - Scrubber - A2-11 (Particulates, Nickel, Iron, Titanium).\r\n\r\nOur preference would be for the air emission monitoring team to carry out the air monitoring between 8:00am and 4:00pm, however the operations run on the two shifts rota: 6:00am to 2:00pm and 2:00pm to 10:00pm.\r\nIf you have any more queries, please feel free to contact me.\r\n\r\nKind Regards,\r\nBart Zdrojowy\r\nHSE Site Lead", "documentcategory": null, "complianceinvestigationid": null}"}

title: Condition 1.4 Change Request New material for Ibuzatrelvir project
document_type: Requests for Approval and Site Reports
metadata_json:
{"compliance_id": "14754111-cb37-f011-a373-0050568a2d1a", "document_type": "Requests for Approval and Site Reports", "document_url": "https://data.epa.ie/leap/api/v1/LicenseeReturns/byid?lr_id=14754111-cb37-f011-a373-0050568a2d1a", "title": "Condition 1.4 Change Request New material for Ibuzatrelvir project", "description": "Dear Sir/Madam, 

Pfizer Ireland Pharmaceuticals (PIP) wishes to inform the Agency under Condition 1.4 of our IE licence that it is proposing to store and use two new materials onsite.

The two new materials are required for a new processing method.

The proposed material Ibuzatrelvir does not contain a substance fulfilling the PBT (persistent/bioaccumulative/toxic) criteria or the vPvB (very persistent/very bioaccumulative) criteria. Product does not contain a substance above legal limits included in the list established in accordance with Article 59(1) of Regulation (EC) No 1907/2006 for having endocrine disrupting properties or is identified to have endocrine disrupting properties in accordance with the criteria set out in Commission Delegated Regulation (EU) 2017/2100 or Commission Regulation (EU) 2018/605.

The second material is Dicalcium Phosphate Anhydrous, this material does not contain a substance fulfilling the PBT (persistent/bioaccumulative/toxic) criteria or the vPvB (very persistent/very bioaccumulative) criteria. Product does not contain a substance above legal limits included in the list established in accordance with Article 59(1) of Regulation (EC) No 1907/2006 for having endocrine disrupting properties or is identified to have endocrine disrupting properties in accordance with the criteria set out in Commission Delegated Regulation (EU) 2017/2100 or Commission Regulation (EU) 2018/605.

There is no additional categories of hazardous material relating to this proposal, as defined by the European Communities (Classification, Packaging, Labelling, and Notification of Dangerous Substances) Regulations 2003 as amended and Regulation No. 1272/2008 as amended.

These new materials will not impact emissions generated on-site.


Safety Data Sheets for Ibuzatrelvir and Dicalcium Phosphate Anhydrous are attached.

Yours sincerely,

Eoin Brett. EHS Advisor", "submission_date": "", "status": "Closed", "metadata": "{"licenseereturnid": "14754111-cb37-f011-a373-0050568a2d1a", "type": "Requests for Approval and Site Reports", "reference": "LR094629", "subject": "Requests for Approval (RFA) and Site Reports:Condition 1 changes", "status": "Closed", "licenceid": "c528b70f-53dc-4c76-9d1c-15d63fd29cd7", "licenceprofileid": "a3a54cba-adf7-4285-b057-7e331f952f80", "datereceived": "2025-05-23T00:00:00", "closeddate": "2025-05-30T00:00:00", "title": "Condition 1.4 Change Request New material for Ibuzatrelvir project", "doctype": "Requests for Approval (RFA) and Site Reports", "docsubtype": "Condition 1 changes", "decision": "Approved", "description": "Dear Sir/Madam, \r\n\r\nPfizer Ireland Pharmaceuticals (PIP) wishes to inform the Agency under Condition 1.4 of our IE licence that it is proposing to store and use two new materials onsite.\r\n\r\nThe two new materials are required for a new processing method.\r\n\r\nThe proposed material Ibuzatrelvir does not contain a substance fulfilling the PBT (persistent/bioaccumulative/toxic) criteria or the vPvB (very persistent/very bioaccumulative) criteria. Product does not contain a substance above legal limits included in the list established in accordance with Article 59(1) of Regulation (EC) No 1907/2006 for having endocrine disrupting properties or is identified to have endocrine disrupting properties in accordance with the criteria set out in Commission Delegated Regulation (EU) 2017/2100 or Commission Regulation (EU) 2018/605.\r\n\r\nThe second material is Dicalcium Phosphate Anhydrous, this material does not contain a substance fulfilling the PBT (persistent/bioaccumulative/toxic) criteria or the vPvB (very persistent/very bioaccumulative) criteria. Product does not contain a substance above legal limits included in the list established in accordance with Article 59(1) of Regulation (EC) No 1907/2006 for having endocrine disrupting properties or is identified to have endocrine disrupting properties in accordance with the criteria set out in Commission Delegated Regulation (EU) 2017/2100 or Commission Regulation (EU) 2018/605.\r\n\r\nThere is no additional categories of hazardous material relating to this proposal, as defined by the European Communities (Classification, Packaging, Labelling, and Notification of Dangerous Substances) Regulations 2003 as amended and Regulation No. 1272/2008 as amended.\r\n\r\nThese new materials will not impact emissions generated on-site.\r\n\r\n\r\nSafety Data Sheets for Ibuzatrelvir and Dicalcium Phosphate Anhydrous are attached.\r\n\r\nYours sincerely,\r\n\r\nEoin Brett. EHS Advisor", "documentcategory": "New or altered Raw Material/Intermediate/Waste", "complianceinvestigationid": null}"}

title: Biological Q Report
metadata_json:
{"compliance_id": "16c808e3-e13a-f011-a373-0050568a2d1a", "document_type": "Monitoring Returns", "document_url": "https://data.epa.ie/leap/api/v1/LicenseeReturns/byid?lr_id=16c808e3-e13a-f011-a373-0050568a2d1a", "title": "Biological Q Report", "description": "Dear Billy,

Please find attached the first Q rating for 2025 for the Ara River. There has been an improvement both up stream and down stream in the rating with both improving to a Q3-4. There has been a welcome return of very pollution sensitive Indicator groups both upstream and downstream of the site. 

The sampling was carried out on the 6th of May during a relatively dry period and the river was at its lowest flow for the year to date. A further Q Rating will take place during the summer.

Regards
Sean Hennebry, 
On behalf of the Arrabawn Tipperary Co-operative Environmental Team.", "submission_date": "", "status": "Closed", "metadata": "{"licenseereturnid": "16c808e3-e13a-f011-a373-0050568a2d1a", "type": "Monitoring Returns", "reference": "LR094712", "subject": "Monitoring Returns:Water", "status": "Closed", "licenceid": "79e8c550-b4bb-4e58-8226-d276d6d75b1e", "licenceprofileid": "026aee83-b768-4261-9048-837d8196b0f3", "datereceived": "2025-05-27T00:00:00", "closeddate": "2025-05-28T00:00:00", "title": "Biological Q Report", "doctype": "Monitoring Returns", "docsubtype": "Water", "decision": "Assessed", "description": "Dear Billy,\r\n\r\nPlease find attached the first Q rating for 2025 for the Ara River. There has been an improvement both up stream and down stream in the rating with both improving to a Q3-4. There has been a welcome return of very pollution sensitive Indicator groups both upstream and downstream of the site. \r\n\r\nThe sampling was carried out on the 6th of May during a relatively dry period and the river was at its lowest flow for the year to date. A further Q Rating will take place during the summer.\r\n\r\nRegards\r\nSean Hennebry, \r\nOn behalf of the Arrabawn Tipperary Co-operative Environmental Team.", "documentcategory": "Compliant", "complianceinvestigationid": null}"}

{"compliance_id": "1e3f15e3-a13b-f011-a373-0050568a2d1a", "document_type": "Non Compliance", "document_url": "https://data.epa.ie/leap/api/v1/NonCompliance/byid?nc_id=1e3f15e3-a13b-f011-a373-0050568a2d1a", "title": "", "description": "Site Visit Report SV31770, 30/04/2025 refers:
The site drainage map submitted to the Agency under licensee return LR086680 in response to Agency site visit reference SV28611 was reviewed during the site visit. A number of discrepancies were noted, however the map was not fully compared to the as built infrastructure. The licensee was required as outlined in site visit report SV27121 (03/10/2023), to ensure that the site drainage map for the installation was updated to include all as built drainage infrastructure and underground pipelines. 
This is a non-compliance with Condition 11.6. 
You are reminded that failure to comply with any condition attached to a licence or revised licence is an offence.", "submission_date": "", "status": "Issued", "metadata": "{"noncomplianceid": "1e3f15e3-a13b-f011-a373-0050568a2d1a", "type": "Non Compliance", "reference": "NC032188", "subject": "Documentation & Procedures", "status": "Issued", "licenceid": "72c5e87d-7c61-e211-9eb5-0050568a69e2", "licenceprofileid": "4035f7d3-b2af-46e5-8013-575501921a7d", "datesubmitted": "2025-05-28T00:00:00", "condition": "Condition 11.6", "complianceinvestigationid": null, "licenseesubmissionid": null, "incidentid": null, "complaintid": null, "description": "Site Visit Report SV31770, 30/04/2025 refers:\nThe site drainage map submitted to the Agency under licensee return LR086680 in response to Agency site visit reference SV28611 was reviewed during the site visit. {"compliance_id": "d100aefb-473a-f011-a373-0050568a2d1a", "document_type": "Non Compliance", "document_url": "https://data.epa.ie/leap/api/v1/NonCompliance/byid?nc_id=d100aefb-473a-f011-a373-0050568a2d1a", "title": "", "description": "Incident reference INCI030340 refers.

- Zinc: 593 mg/kg DM vs the Maximum Metal Concentration Limit of 400 mg/kg DM

This is non-compliant with Condition 8.8.1 of the EPA Licence.

The Licensee is reminded that failure to comply with any Condition attached to a Licence or revised Licence is an offence.

{"compliance_id": "03fefdde-03f9-ef11-a325-0050568a66b2", "document_type": "Site Visit", "document_url": "https://data.epa.ie/leap/api/v1/SiteVisit/byid?sv_id=03fefdde-03f9-ef11-a325-0050568a66b2", "title": "", "description": "", "submission_date": "", "status": "Closed", "metadata": "{\"sitevisitid\": \"03fefdde-03f9-ef11-a325-0050568a66b2\", \"type\": \"Site Visit\", \"subject\": \"2025 Enforcement Plan - Templemore\", \"reference\": \"SV32315\", \"status\": \"Closed\", \"licence_id\": \"c21c76ab-203e-e111-ab87-0050568a69e2\", \"licenceprofile_id\": \"903d6a51-0d0b-45cf-9785-fff94d5eb977\", \"licenseesubmission_id\": null, \"visit_date\": \"2025-04-17T00:00:00\", \"report_issued_date\": \"2025-05-28T00:00:00\", \"compliance\": \"N/A\", \"summary\": \"

The site visit found that the treatment plant is fully compliant with its licensed Emission Limit Values. However, operational issues were observed regarding the rate of desludging. Excessive solids were observed in both clarifiers and may result in solid carry over events to the river Suir if corrective actions are not implemented. 

\\n

The most recent biological sampling conducted on the River Suir indicated that downstream of WWTP is moderately polluted with a Q3 designation. Uisce Éireann are required to put in place a biological monitoring programme U/S and D/S of the Templemore WWTP to establish the impact on the River Suir from this agglomeration. 

\\n

Uisce Éireann shall review the current rate of desludging and put in place measures to ensure that an adequate supply of coagulant is available on site at all times. 

\\n

Uisce Éireann shall revert with a plan to address all the recommendations in this site visit revert and confirm when all are addressed. 

\", \"announced\": \"Yes\", \"visittype\": \"OEE\", \"instigated_by\": \"Enforcement Plan Visit\", \"sampletaken\": \"No\", \"odourassessment\": \"No\", \"adourassessmentcompliant\": \"N/A\", \"licence_regno\": \"D0190-01\", \"profile_number\": \"D0190\"}"}

{"compliance_id": "3f11942b-a6d1-ef11-a325-0050568a66b2", "document_type": "Site Visit", "document_url": "https://data.epa.ie/leap/api/v1/SiteVisit/byid?sv_id=3f11942b-a6d1-ef11-a325-0050568a66b2", "title": "", "description": "", "submission_date": "", "status": "Closed", "metadata": "{\"sitevisitid\": \"3f11942b-a6d1-ef11-a325-0050568a66b2\", \"type\": \"Site Visit\", \"subject\": \"Reg P0047-03 Annual Plan 2025\", \"reference\": \"SV31770\", \"status\": \"Closed\", \"licence_id\": \"72c5e87d-7c61-e211-9eb5-0050568a69e2\", \"licenceprofile_id\": \"4035f7d3-b2af-46e5-8013-575501921a7d\", \"licenseesubmission_id\": null, \"visit_date\": \"2025-04-30T00:00:00\", \"report_issued_date\": \"2025-05-28T00:00:00\", \"compliance\": \"No\", \"summary\": \"

The Agency carried out this site visit as part of the OEE annual site visit programme to evaluate the licensee’s compliance with the requirements of the licence.

\\n

The licensee was found to be non-compliant with its Licence at the time of the Agency site visit. Four non-compliances were recorded in relation to safe & permanent access, cooling water monitoring, site drawings & effluent monitoring. In addition, observations were raised in relation to monitoring, concrete hardstanding & labelling. The issues raised require action to be taken by the licensee as specified in this report.

\\n

The Licensee is required to submit a response to the non-compliances raised in this site visit report within 21 days of the date of issue of this report (using the ‘Make a Response’ link on the Site Visits page in EDEN, as outlined in the Follow-up Actions section of this report).

{"compliance_id": "4d04f3ba-dcbd-ef11-a324-0050568a66b2", "document_type": "Site Visit", "document_url": "https://data.epa.ie/leap/api/v1/SiteVisit/byid?sv_id=4d04f3ba-dcbd-ef11-a324-0050568a66b2", "title": "", "description": "", "submission_date": "", "status": "Closed", "metadata": "{\"sitevisitid\": \"4d04f3ba-dcbd-ef11-a324-0050568a66b2\", \"type\": \"Site Visit\", \"subject\": \"ORM Monitoring Visit (Planned 2025)\", \"reference\": \"SV31277\", \"status\": \"Closed\", \"licence_id\": \"8cc9e87d-7c61-e211-9eb5-0050568a69e2\", \"licenceprofile_id\": \"3ea51c8d-edd3-40a4-afc0-7817e6ec6ff7\", \"licenseesubmission_id\": null, \"visit_date\": \"2025-05-08T00:00:00\", \"report_issued_date\": \"2025-05-28T00:00:00\", \"compliance\": \"Yes\", \"summary\": \"

The Agency carried out this site visit as part of the Agency’s emissions monitoring programme. The monitoring report is attached.

\\n

The Licensee was found to be in compliance with its Licence on the day of the site visit. Two observations were raised in relation to foul and surface water monitoring results. 

\\n

The Agency notes a low pH value in the effluent discharge at monitoring point SE1. In addition, atypical results for ammonia and suspended solids are noted in surface water samples from monitoring points SW4 and SW5. Compliance will be further assessed throughout annual monitoring returns and site visits.

\\n

The issue raised requires action to be taken by the Licensee as specified in this report.

\\n

The Licensee is required to submit a response to the observations raised in this site visit report within 21 days of the date of issue of this report (using the ‘Make a Response’ link on the Site Visits page in EDEN), as outlined in the Follow-up Actions section of this report).

\\n

The Licensee is reminded that failure to comply with any Condition attached to a Licence or revised Licence is an offence.
