{"compliance_id": "a703f3ba-dcbd-ef11-a324-0050568a66b2", "document_type": "Site Visit", "document_url": "https://data.epa.ie/leap/api/v1/SiteVisit/byid?sv_id=a703f3ba-dcbd-ef11-a324-0050568a66b2", "title": "", "description": "", "submission_date": "", "status": "Closed", "metadata": "{\"sitevisitid\": \"a703f3ba-dcbd-ef11-a324-0050568a66b2\", \"type\": \"Site Visit\", \"subject\": \"ORM Monitoring Visit (Planned 2025)\", \"reference\": \"SV31194\", \"status\": \"Closed\", \"licence_id\": \"0975138a-d254-e611-9a04-0050568a69e2\", \"licenceprofile_id\": \"77385efd-ce54-e611-9a04-0050568a69e2\", \"licenseesubmission_id\": null, \"visit_date\": \"2025-04-01T00:00:00\", \"report_issued_date\": \"2025-05-28T00:00:00\", \"compliance\": \"Yes\", \"summary\": \"

The Agency carried out this site visit as part of the Agency’s emissions monitoring programme. The monitoring report is attached.

\\n

The Licensee was found to be in compliance with its Licence on the day of the site visit. An observation was raised in relation to groundwater monitoring results.

\\n

The Agency notes that a number of groundwater parameters including Ammonia, Ammonium, Chloride, Manganese, Potassium, Sodium and ortho-Phosphate were elevated at four sampled monitoring locations; MW1, MW2; MW3A and MW4 as referred in Section 1.1 of this site visit report. Compliance will be further assessed throughout annual monitoring returns and site visits.

\\n

The issue raised require action to be taken by the licensee as specified in this report.

\\n

The Licensee is required to submit a response to the observation raised in this site visit report within 21 days of the date of issue of this report (using the ‘Make a Response’ link on the Site Visits page in EDEN), as outlined in the Follow-up Actions section of this report).

\\n

The Licensee is reminded that failure to comply with any Condition attached to a Licence or revised Licence is an offence.

The Licensee was found to be non-compliant with its Licence at the time of the Agency site visit. A non-compliance was recorded in relation to safe and permanent access to monitoring point (non-compliance reference NC032175). In addition, an observation was raised in relation to groundwater monitoring results.

{"compliance_id": "1ede05b3-163b-f011-a373-0050568a2d1a", "document_type": "Incident", "document_url": "https://data.epa.ie/leap/api/v1/Incident/byid?incident_id=1ede05b3-163b-f011-a373-0050568a2d1a", "title": "", "description": "On Monday 26may25, a Surface water TOC alarm occurred on the monitoring system above the TOC action alarm level.

There was one sample above the action level of 30mg/l (actual reading: 32.4mg/l). Afterwards, the TOC Level dropped to within range and remained consistent since.

In total there was 1 sampling event above the action limit of 30mg/L. Each sampling event is approximately 8 minutes.

There was high flow rate recorded at the time (above 262m3/hr). Heavy rainfall was happening in the area at the time.

A site investigation commenced by Veolia Operations after the warning and action levels for TOC were exceeded. An inspection of both the bio detector and venturi were performed. No faults were identified. The surface water discharge was visually inspected and no discolouration or odour was identified. The pH was within normal alarm parameters. There were no unusual activities taking place at the time that contributed to the alarm.

No leaks or spillages were identified on site. No tankers being offloaded during this time.", "submission_date": "", "status": "Open", "metadata": "{"incidentid": "1ede05b3-163b-f011-a373-0050568a2d1a", "type": "Incident", "reference": "INCI030398", "subject": "Trigger Level Reached", "status": "Open", "licenceid": "a2c7e87d-7c61-e211-9eb5-0050568a69e2", "licenceprofileid": "52836abc-c980-4735-818e-6ee1bcfd6152", "complianceinvestigationid": null, "incidentcategory": "1. Minor", "nature": "Trigger Level Reached", "vulnerablereceptors": "South Dublin County Council (SDCC) attenuation pond (Grange Castle business park)\r\n", "receptors": "Water", "likelihoodofreoccurence": "Low", "likelycause": "Adverse Weather", "newrecurring": "Recurring", "datenotified": "2025-05-27T00:00:00", "closeddate": null, "approximatestart": "2025-05-26T22:54:00", "firstnoticed": "2025-05-26T22:54:00", "finishtime": "2025-05-26T22:57:00", "notifiedparties": "", "dischargepoint": "No", "emissionpointname": "n/a", "uncontrolledrelease": "n/a", "description": "On Monday 26may25, a Surface water TOC alarm occurred on the monitoring system above the TOC action alarm level.\r\n\r\nThere was one sample above the action level of 30mg/l (actual reading: 32.4mg/l). Afterwards, the TOC Level dropped to within range and remained consistent since.\r\n\r\nIn total there was 1 sampling event above the action limit of 30mg/L. Each sampling event is approximately 8 minutes.\r\n\r\nThere was high flow rate recorded at the time (above 262m3/hr). Heavy rainfall was happening in the area at the time.\r\n\r\nA site investigation commenced by Veolia Operations after the warning and action levels for TOC were exceeded. An inspection of both the bio detector and venturi were performed. No faults were identified. The surface water discharge was visually inspected and no discolouration or odour was identified. The pH was within normal alarm parameters. There were no unusual activities taking place at the time that contributed to the alarm.\r\n\r\nNo leaks or spillages were identified on site. No tankers being offloaded during this time.", "otherrelevantinformation": "N/A", "impactonenvironment": "None- Pfizer believe the elevated TOC is directly related to the heavy rainfall present during this period and organic matter present in the SW lines.\r\n", "activityinprogress": "Normal site activities. No unusual activities noted during this period.\r\n", "dischargedetails": "SW1 (Surface Water Discharge Point)\r\n"}"}

{"compliance_id": "23225a4d-143b-f011-a373-0050568a2d1a", "document_type": "Incident", "document_url": "https://data.epa.ie/leap/api/v1/Incident/byid?incident_id=23225a4d-143b-f011-a373-0050568a2d1a", "title": "", "description": "Uncontrolled release occurred on Friday 23rd of May between 7-11am at Rathcormac WWTP. On Thursday 22nd a third party contractor working on site accidently hit the emergency stop for the decant in the SBR without realising. This was the only part of the cycle effected so the SBR continued to fill, aerate and settle as normal but didn't decant resulting in the SBR filling, the buffer tank filling and then the storm tank filling before eventually going to overflow on 23rd at 7am. The caretaker noticed when he got to site at 8.30am on 23rd and disengaged the emergency stop but the cycle was in progress and the next decant was due to occur at 10.30-11am, so the plant continued to overflow until the next decant freed up space for incoming flows to the plant. 37m3 went to overflow, this would have went through screening at the inlet works before going to overflow. ", "submission_date": "", "status": "Open", "metadata": "{\"incidentid\": \"23225a4d-143b-f011-a373-0050568a2d1a\", \"type\": \"Incident\", \"reference\": \"INCI030397\", \"subject\": \"Uncontrolled Release\", \"status\": \"Open\", \"licenceid\": \"de1f76ab-203e-e111-ab87-0050568a69e2\", \"licenceprofileid\": \"9ee467dd-4c75-4ff9-a359-6a760e89a578\", \"complianceinvestigationid\": null, \"incidentcategory\": \"1. On Thursday 22nd a third party contractor working on site accidently hit the emergency stop for the decant in the SBR without realising. This was the only part of the cycle effected so the SBR continued to fill, aerate and settle as normal but didn't decant resulting in the SBR filling, the buffer tank filling and then the storm tank filling before eventually going to overflow on 23rd at 7am. The caretaker noticed when he got to site at 8.30am on 23rd and disengaged the emergency stop but the cycle was in progress and the next decant was due to occur at 10.30-11am, so the plant continued to overflow until the next decant freed up space for incoming flows to the plant. 37m3 went to overflow, this would have went through screening at the inlet works before going to overflow. \", \"description\": \"Uncontrolled release occurred on Friday 23rd of May between 7-11am at Rathcormac WWTP. On Thursday 22nd a third party contractor working on site accidently hit the emergency stop for the decant in the SBR without realising. This was the only part of the cycle effected so the SBR continued to fill, aerate and settle as normal but didn't decant resulting in the SBR filling, the buffer tank filling and then the storm tank filling before eventually going to overflow on 23rd at 7am. The caretaker noticed when he got to site at 8.30am on 23rd and disengaged the emergency stop but the cycle was in progress and the next decant was due to occur at 10.30-11am, so the plant continued to overflow until the next decant freed up space for incoming flows to the plant. 37m3 went to overflow, this would have went through screening at the inlet works before going to overflow. \", \"otherrelevantinformation\": null, \"impactonenvironment\": \"none known\", \"activityinprogress\": \"Scheduled maintenance by third party contractor day prior to overflow\", \"dischargedetails\": \"TPEFF0500D0200SW002\"}"}

{"compliance_id": "273aaa0e-093b-f011-a373-0050568a2d1a", "document_type": "Incident", "document_url": "https://data.epa.ie/leap/api/v1/Incident/byid?incident_id=273aaa0e-093b-f011-a373-0050568a2d1a", "title": "", "description": "On morning of 22/05/2025 operators at Swords WWTP noticed that there was an issue with the mixer in the secondary sludge tank at the plant. When attempting to retrieve the mixer the chain that secured the device snapped and the mixer was lost to the bottom of the tank. In order to retrieve the mixer operators had to drain down the tank, beginning to remove loads on 23/05/2025. The drain down of the tank was completed on 27/05/2025 and the mixer was recovered. Currently the mixer pumps are being investigated but it is believed ragging caused the initial issue with the mixer. Once the pump has been cleaned and is fully functional it will be returned to the sludge tank for operation - expected by end of 27/05/2025. A spare chain, which had been stored onsite, will be reattached prior to returning the mixer to the tank. The issue with the mixer has been put down to regular wear and tear. ", "submission_date": "", "status": "Open", "metadata": "{\"incidentid\": \"273aaa0e-093b-f011-a373-0050568a2d1a\", \"type\": \"Incident\", \"reference\": \"INCI030395\", \"subject\": \"Abatement equipment off-line\", \"status\": \"Open\", \"licenceid\": \"261d76ab-203e-e111-ab87-0050568a69e2\", \"licenceprofileid\": \"b6f6a05d-2001-434b-bbf5-49e2a3c8e6c2\", \"complianceinvestigationid\": null, \"incidentcategory\": \"1. When attempting to retrieve the mixer the chain that secured the device snapped and the mixer was lost to the bottom of the tank. In order to retrieve the mixer operators had to drain down the tank, beginning to remove loads on 23/05/2025. The drain down of the tank was completed on 27/05/2025 and the mixer was recovered. Currently the mixer pumps are being investigated but it is believed ragging caused the initial issue with the mixer. Once the pump has been cleaned and is fully functional it will be returned to the sludge tank for operation - expected by end of 27/05/2025. {"compliance_id": "d49e206b-f03a-f011-a373-0050568a2d1a", "document_type": "Incident", "document_url": "https://data.epa.ie/leap/api/v1/Incident/byid?incident_id=d49e206b-f03a-f011-a373-0050568a2d1a", "title": "", "description": "Incident 27.5.25 Breach of ELV. for Ammonia 7.63mg/l and Ortho-P 1.29 mg/l on sample taken on the 30-04-25. Level sensor on the ferric dosing tank failed on the 28-4-25 and as a result the tank was reading half full when it was empty. Technicians repaired the level sensor and filled the tank on the 29-04-25, the ferric dosing system was not fully ran through the lines before the monthly sample was taken and thus contributed to the exceedance. Apologies for the late notification, we have carried incident report training with Clare and Limerick caretaker and WW staff in the meantime to ensure that all incidents are reported to WW compliance in a timely manner. Results for May sample taken on the 09-05-2025 show the plant is back in compliance ammonia was 0.09mg/l and Ortho-P was 0.24mg/l.", "submission_date": "", "status": "Open", "metadata": "{\"incidentid\": \"d49e206b-f03a-f011-a373-0050568a2d1a\", \"type\": \"Incident\", \"reference\": \"INCI030393\", \"subject\": \"Breach of ELV\", \"status\": \"Open\", \"licenceid\": \"dc1e76ab-203e-e111-ab87-0050568a69e2\", \"licenceprofileid\": \"f92bc242-d585-44bd-8c9e-78fd857966c6\", \"complianceinvestigationid\": null, \"incidentcategory\": \"1. Minor\", \"nature\": \"Breach of ELV\", \"vulnerablereceptors\": \"Clonlea Lough\", \"receptors\": \"Water\", \"likelihoodofreoccurence\": \"Medium\", \"likelycause\": \"Plant or equipment breakdown at WWTP\", \"newrecurring\": \"New\", \"datenotified\": \"2025-05-27T00:00:00\", \"closeddate\": null, \"approximatestart\": \"2025-04-30T00:00:00\", \"firstnoticed\": \"2025-05-26T00:00:00\", \"finishtime\": \"2025-05-09T00:00:00\", \"notifiedparties\": \"Inland Fisheries Ireland\", \"dischargepoint\": \"Yes\", \"emissionpointname\": \"TPEFF0300D0420SW001\", \"uncontrolledrelease\": \"n/a\", \"description\": \"Incident 27.5.25 Breach of ELV. for Ammonia 7.63mg/l and Ortho-P 1.29 mg/l on sample taken on the 30-04-25. Level sensor on the ferric dosing tank failed on the 28-4-25 and as a result the tank was reading half full when it was empty. Technicians repaired the level sensor and filled the tank on the 29-04-25, the ferric dosing system was not fully ran through the lines before the monthly sample was taken and thus contributed to the exceedance. Apologies for the late notification, we have carried incident report training with Clare and Limerick caretaker and WW staff in the meantime to ensure that all incidents are reported to WW compliance in a timely manner. Results for May sample taken on the 09-05-2025 show the plant is back in compliance ammonia was 0.09mg/l and Ortho-P was 0.24mg/l.\", \"otherrelevantinformation\": \"All WW staff in Clare and Limerick received incident training on 19-05-2025. \", \"impactonenvironment\": \"No impact on water quality\", \"activityinprogress\": \"Normal plant activity\", \"dischargedetails\": null}"}

title: Site Visit Report SV31828, 1.2 & Rejection Notice
metadata_json:
{"compliance_id": "ac7af3be-8235-f011-a373-0050568a2d1a", "document_type": "Site Updates/Notifications", "document_url": "https://data.epa.ie/leap/api/v1/LicenseeReturns/byid?lr_id=ac7af3be-8235-f011-a373-0050568a2d1a", "title": "Site Visit Report SV31828, 1.2 & Rejection Notice", "description": "
International Aerospace Coatings Limited will address, and correct issues raised as outlined in the Rejection Notice to Licence return ref: LR090095
External Service Provider was contracted, and below corrective actions are currently in progress and expected completion date end of June 2025.
Invoice for completion of Works attached

•	The sampling ports are too small for isokinetic testing and need to be 4” in diameter 
Corrective Action: Sampling ports will be replaced to be 4” in diameter and re-located on Stack A2-1 and A2-2

•	Insufficient platform depth to safely use the correct probe length
Corrective Action: Sampling ports will be re-located and guardrail depth will be extended around the stacks to safely use the correct probe length.

•	One 1 line safe to use as Line B is facing towards and in close proximity to the roof edge (Phot 11 RHS Port) 
Corrective Action: It will not be necessary to use Line B with the re-location of the sampling ports and extension of the guard rail depth.

•	Supporting bar blocking clear access to Line B (Photo 11) 
Corrective Action: The re-location of the sampling ports will eradicate the requirement for access to Line B for isokinetic testing.
", "submission_date": "", "status": "Closed", "metadata": "{"licenseereturnid": "ac7af3be-8235-f011-a373-0050568a2d1a", "type": "Site Updates/Notifications", "reference": "LR094548", "subject": "Site Updates/Notifications:Response to EPA Report", "status": "Closed", "licenceid": "add47a51-4a0b-41c2-8bfc-0781a3f55408", "licenceprofileid": "cf63bf56-c643-44da-a256-0dee80727507", "datereceived": "2025-05-20T00:00:00", "closeddate": "2025-05-27T00:00:00", "title": "Site Visit Report SV31828, 1.2 & Rejection Notice", "doctype": "Site Updates/Notifications", "docsubtype": "Response to EPA Report", "decision": "Assessed", "description": "\r\nInternational Aerospace Coatings Limited will address, and correct issues raised as outlined in the Rejection Notice to Licence return ref: LR090095\r\nExternal Service Provider was contracted, and below corrective actions are currently in progress and expected completion date end of June 2025.\r\nInvoice for completion of Works attached\r\n\r\n\u2022\tThe sampling ports are too small for isokinetic testing and need to be 4\u201d in diameter \r\nCorrective Action: Sampling ports will be replaced to be 4\u201d in diameter and re-located on Stack A2-1 and A2-2\r\n\r\n\u2022\tInsufficient platform depth to safely use the correct probe length\r\nCorrective Action: Sampling ports will be re-located and guardrail depth will be extended around the stacks to safely use the correct probe length.\r\n\r\n\u2022\tOne 1 line safe to use as Line B is facing towards and in close proximity to the roof edge (Phot 11 RHS Port) \r\nCorrective Action: It will not be necessary to use Line B with the re-location of the sampling ports and extension of the guard rail depth.\r\n\r\n\u2022\tSupporting bar blocking clear access to Line B (Photo 11) \r\nCorrective Action: The re-location of the sampling ports will eradicate the requirement for access to Line B for isokinetic testing.\r\n", "documentcategory": null, "complianceinvestigationid": null}"}

\\n

Dear Reporter,

\\n

The EPA has reviewed the 2024 PRTR data submitted for your facility through the EPR online form in EDEN.

\\n

PRTR ACTIVITY:

\\n
    \\n
  • PRTR Activity 4(a)(viii) was reported as the main activity in 2024. Six other 4(a) activities were also reported. Please review if all reported activities are relevant for the site.

PRTR Team.

Please note that this EPA correspondence, and your response to it, will be published on the EPA’s Licence & Enforcement Access Portal (LEAP) which provides online public access to compliance and enforcement correspondence between the EPA and regulated operators.

{"compliance_id": "697a8a31-a6d1-ef11-a325-0050568a66b2", "document_type": "Site Visit", "document_url": "https://data.epa.ie/leap/api/v1/SiteVisit/byid?sv_id=697a8a31-a6d1-ef11-a325-0050568a66b2", "title": "", "description": "", "submission_date": "", "status": "Closed", "metadata": "{\"sitevisitid\": \"697a8a31-a6d1-ef11-a325-0050568a66b2\", \"type\": \"Site Visit\", \"subject\": \"Reg W0062-02 Annual Plan 2025\", \"reference\": \"SV31832\", \"status\": \"Closed\", \"licence_id\": \"70f3307e-2096-447c-885d-34645f6ed7cf\", \"licenceprofile_id\": \"2aee786a-3e62-4fe0-9010-d9c5f81a3461\", \"licenseesubmission_id\": \"56189cbc-804b-f011-a373-0050568a2d1a\", \"visit_date\": \"2025-04-24T00:00:00\", \"report_issued_date\": \"2025-05-27T00:00:00\", \"compliance\": \"No\", \"summary\": \"

Donegal County Council's Churchtown Landfill (the licensee) has been identified by the Agency as a Water Framework Directive (WFD) significant pressure site due to its impact on the receiving surface water body (River Finn).

The Agency carried out this site visit as part of the OEE annual site visit programme to evaluate the licensee\\u2019s compliance with the requirements of the licence. The licensee was found to be non-compliant with its Licence at the time of the Agency site visit. Two non-compliances were recorded in relation to groundwater monitoring infrastructure and landfill leachate breakout. In addition, observations were raised in relation to monitoring infrastructure and annual monitoring returns. A compliance investigation has been opened on the leachate breakout issue (Ref. CI002204). The issues raised require action to be taken by the licensee as specified in this report (and/or in compliance investigation CI002204).

\", \"announced\": \"Yes\", \"visittype\": \"OEE\", \"instigated_by\": \"Enforcement Plan Visit\", \"sampletaken\": \"No\", \"odourassessment\": \"No\", \"adourassessmentcompliant\": \"N/A\", \"licence_regno\": \"W0062-02\", \"profile_number\": \"W0062\"}"}

{"compliance_id": "8b10942b-a6d1-ef11-a325-0050568a66b2", "document_type": "Site Visit", "document_url": "https://data.epa.ie/leap/api/v1/SiteVisit/byid?sv_id=8b10942b-a6d1-ef11-a325-0050568a66b2", "title": "", "description": "", "submission_date": "", "status": "Closed", "metadata": "{\"sitevisitid\": \"8b10942b-a6d1-ef11-a325-0050568a66b2\", \"type\": \"Site Visit\", \"subject\": \"Reg W0060-03 Annual Plan 2025\", \"reference\": \"SV31730\", \"status\": \"Closed\", \"licence_id\": \"5ec9e87d-7c61-e211-9eb5-0050568a69e2\", \"licenceprofile_id\": \"2bf2b721-b89d-4052-95cc-c61f0bcb1a5d\", \"licenseesubmission_id\": null, \"visit_date\": \"2025-05-02T00:00:00\", \"report_issued_date\": \"2025-05-27T00:00:00\", \"compliance\": \"Yes\", \"summary\": \"

The Agency carried out this site visit as part of the OEE annual site visit programme to evaluate Louth County Council's (the licensee's) compliance with the requirements of Industrial Emissions (IE) licence Reg. No. W0060-03 held for Whiteriver Landfill, Whiteriver & Gunstown Townland, Co. Louth.

\\n

The licensee was found to be in compliance with its Licence in relation to the areas inspected during the site visit. Two observations were raised in relation to health and safety and vegetation growth. The issues raised require action to be taken by the licensee as specified in this report.

{"compliance_id": "9cbed0dd-3f21-f011-a373-0050568a2d1a", "document_type": "Site Visit", "document_url": "https://data.epa.ie/leap/api/v1/SiteVisit/byid?sv_id=9cbed0dd-3f21-f011-a373-0050568a2d1a", "title": "", "description": "", "submission_date": "", "status": "Closed", "metadata": "{\"sitevisitid\": \"9cbed0dd-3f21-f011-a373-0050568a2d1a\", \"type\": \"Site Visit\", \"subject\": \"W0062-02, Additional Monitoring Visit\", \"reference\": \"SV32524\", \"status\": \"Closed\", \"licence_id\": \"70f3307e-2096-447c-885d-34645f6ed7cf\", \"licenceprofile_id\": \"2aee786a-3e62-4fe0-9010-d9c5f81a3461\", \"licenseesubmission_id\": \"bc6e6ee2-804b-f011-a373-0050568a2d1a\", \"visit_date\": \"2025-04-25T00:00:00\", \"report_issued_date\": \"2025-05-27T00:00:00\", \"compliance\": \"No\", \"summary\": \"

The Agency carried out this site visit to investigate an incident (Ref. No. INCI030224) in relation to a possible leachate breakout, observed during site visit on 24/04/2025 (Ref. SV31832). 

\\n

One non-compliance was recorded in relation to elevated concentrations of ammonia, suspended solids and Chemical Oxygen Demand (COD) in surface water. The issues raised require action to be taken by the licensee as specified in this report (and/or in compliance investigation CI002204).

{"compliance_id": "d20255ba-4a3a-f011-a373-0050568a2d1a", "document_type": "Incident", "document_url": "https://data.epa.ie/leap/api/v1/Incident/byid?incident_id=d20255ba-4a3a-f011-a373-0050568a2d1a", "title": "", "description": "Operational sample taken on 13/05/2025 yielded a non compliant results of 135.2mg/l for Suspended solids. the sample also yielded low level breach of ELV for BOD and COD at 25.5 and 146mg/l respectively. the operator noted depressed DO levels and further Investigations identified the cause of the issue to be a biological Sludge issue. Additional sludge was removed from the plant to aid settlement and follow up samples taken on 20/05/2025 yielded the following compliant results, SS = 3.2mg/l and COD = 25mg/l. The operator will continue to monitor very closely.", "submission_date": "", "status": "Open", "metadata": "{\"incidentid\": \"d20255ba-4a3a-f011-a373-0050568a2d1a\", \"type\": \"Incident\", \"reference\": \"INCI030384\", \"subject\": \"Breach of ELV\", \"status\": \"Open\", \"licenceid\": \"4a1f76ab-203e-e111-ab87-0050568a69e2\", \"licenceprofileid\": \"1813c3d6-21db-430d-94df-0413c0626307\", \"complianceinvestigationid\": null, \"incidentcategory\": \"1. Minor\", \"nature\": \"Breach of ELV\", \"vulnerablereceptors\": \"River Suir\", \"receptors\": \"Water\", \"likelihoodofreoccurence\": \"Low\", \"likelycause\": \"WWTP biological sludge issue\", \"newrecurring\": \"New\", \"datenotified\": \"2025-05-26T00:00:00\", \"closeddate\": null, \"approximatestart\": \"2025-05-13T00:00:00\", \"firstnoticed\": \"2025-05-13T00:00:00\", \"finishtime\": \"2025-05-20T00:00:00\", \"notifiedparties\": \"Inland Fisheries Ireland\", \"dischargepoint\": \"Yes\", \"emissionpointname\": \"TPEFF2900D0452SW001\", \"uncontrolledrelease\": \"n/a\", \"description\": \"Operational sample taken on 13/05/2025 yielded a non compliant results of 135.2mg/l for Suspended solids. the sample also yielded low level breach of ELV for BOD and COD at 25.5 and 146mg/l respectively. the operator noted depressed DO levels and further Investigations identified the cause of the issue to be a biological Sludge issue. Additional sludge was removed from the plant to aid settlement and follow up samples taken on 20/05/2025 yielded the following compliant results, SS = 3.2mg/l and COD = 25mg/l. The operator will continue to monitor very closely.\", \"otherrelevantinformation\": null, \"impactonenvironment\": \"no impact anticipated due to high dilution in Rive Suir\", \"activityinprogress\": \"Normal Activity\", \"dischargedetails\": null}"}

title: Reply to EPA non-compliances
metadata_json:
{"compliance_id": "22ed5c4d-393a-f011-a373-0050568a2d1a", "document_type": "Site Updates/Notifications", "document_url": "https://data.epa.ie/leap/api/v1/LicenseeReturns/byid?lr_id=22ed5c4d-393a-f011-a373-0050568a2d1a", "title": "Reply to EPA non-compliances", "description": "Hi Niamh/Caroline, 
Here is some follow up information in relation to your recent site visit of Tuesday 20th May which we were unable to clarify on the day.
1.	Regarding Documentary proof as per 8.3.7 that we inspect every solid load tipped - this is actually provided for and ticked and signed on every weighbridge docket see copy attached.
2.	Auto Leak Detection System for underground liquid feeding 3.15.7 – as explained at the meeting this is monitored on a continuous basis on the Scada system for the plant via level sensors which are fitted in each of the liquid storage tanks. 
3.	Inspection system for overground pipe valves and flanges 6.13 – as mentioned on the day please find attached the weekly inspection sheet for the inspection of these overground pipes to and from digesters and after storage.
4.	Provision of a catchment system to collect any leaks from overground pipe valves and flanges 3.20.1 – The site is fully bunded and therefore compliant with regards to the catchment system. 
5.	Programme for Fugitive Emissions  – There is a programme in place as per the attached odour management plan. This states that we carry out a FGE test annually. The 2023 annual FGE test was uploaded to Eden 29.06.2023 and the 2024 annual FGE test was uploaded on 29.06.2023. The 2025 FGE test is not scheduled yet but will be shortly and we will be advising the agency once this is confirmed.
6.	Odour Impact Assessment every 3 years 6.14.4 – Denis had said on the day that this was done, however he had it mixed up with the 2023 odour Management Plan.

", "submission_date": "", "status": "Open", "metadata": "{"licenseereturnid": "22ed5c4d-393a-f011-a373-0050568a2d1a", "type": "Site Updates/Notifications", "reference": "LR094663", "subject": "Site Updates/Notifications:Other", "status": "Open", "licenceid": "b9ed8364-a617-4118-bd17-d27fa8ba862f", "licenceprofileid": "8851c993-adac-4688-93b4-13c9820afc14", "datereceived": "2025-05-26T00:00:00", "closeddate": null, "title": "Reply to EPA non-compliances", "doctype": "Site Updates/Notifications", "docsubtype": "Other", "decision": "Assessed", "description": "Hi Niamh/Caroline, \r\nHere is some follow up information in relation to your recent site visit of Tuesday 20th May which we were unable to clarify on the day.\r\n1.\tRegarding Documentary proof as per 8.3.7 that we inspect every solid load tipped - this is actually provided for and ticked and signed on every weighbridge docket see copy attached.\r\n2.\tAuto Leak Detection System for underground liquid feeding 3.15.7 \u2013 as explained at the meeting this is monitored on a continuous basis on the Scada system for the plant via level sensors which are fitted in each of the liquid storage tanks. \r\n3.\tInspection system for overground pipe valves and flanges 6.13 \u2013 as mentioned on the day please find attached the weekly inspection sheet for the inspection of these overground pipes to and from digesters and after storage.\r\n4.\tProvision of a catchment system to collect any leaks from overground pipe valves and flanges 3.20.1 \u2013 The site is fully bunded and therefore compliant with regards to the catchment system. \r\n5.\tProgramme for Fugitive Emissions  \u2013 There is a programme in place as per the attached odour management plan. This states that we carry out a FGE test annually. The 2023 annual FGE test was uploaded to Eden 29.06.2023 and the 2024 annual FGE test was uploaded on 29.06.2023. The 2025 FGE test is not scheduled yet but will be shortly and we will be advising the agency once this is confirmed.\r\n6.\tOdour Impact Assessment every 3 years 6.14.4 \u2013 Denis had said on the day that this was done, however he had it mixed up with the 2023 odour Management Plan.\r\n\r\n", "documentcategory": null, "complianceinvestigationid": null}"}

title: Response to SV30257
metadata_json:
{"compliance_id": "cc12e5dd-573a-f011-a373-0050568a2d1a", "document_type": "Site Updates/Notifications", "document_url": "https://data.epa.ie/leap/api/v1/LicenseeReturns/byid?lr_id=cc12e5dd-573a-f011-a373-0050568a2d1a", "title": "Response to SV30257", "description": "Dear Inspector

Bord na Mona would like to make the following response/submissions:

The licensee shall:

Respond to observations raised in sections 2.1, 2.2 and 2.3 of the site visit report (Ref. SV30257), dated 03/03/2025;

2.1 The scrap material are weirs/sluice gates and it is hoped to reuse these flow controls on other BNM bogs, so will be scheduled for removal, but currently do not constitute a risk to the environment.
2.2 Please see attached Final Validation Report, including commentry on the monitoring results.
2.3 As reported in the Independent Closure Audit conducted by Tobins, submitted to the Agency on the 21/09/2021 and assessed, the peat deposition site has performed as predicted since the last deposition in 2013 with no significant impacts on the groundwater or surface water. The downgradient rivers and bedrock aquifer are at good status under the WFD 2013-2018. The Munhin and Owenmore are not at risk based on the available EPA data.

In respect of soil and groundwater aspects of the site, based on the investigations, assessments
at the site by TOBIN, we are of the opinion that the condition of the site is not causing or likely
to cause off-site environmental pollution and the site is in a satisfactory state, and
environmental liabilities identified in the CRAMP have been addressed.


Submit an EPR return for calendar year 2024, in accordance with condition 11.8. 

An EPR has been submitted to the Agency on the 26/05/2025

Bord na Mona are of the opinion that it has now submitted all reasonable requests to the Agency since the application for surrender, including all monitoring returns, the ICA, Cert of Title, the application form and associated fees and now the final validation report.

Kind regards

Enda McDonagh
Bord na Mona
", "submission_date": "", "status": "Open", "metadata": "{"licenseereturnid": "cc12e5dd-573a-f011-a373-0050568a2d1a", "type": "Site Updates/Notifications", "reference": "LR094689", "subject": "Site Updates/Notifications:Other", "status": "Open", "licenceid": "00cae87d-7c61-e211-9eb5-0050568a69e2", "licenceprofileid": "cbb7c12c-2b33-4174-8479-b90ca354bd9b", "datereceived": "2025-05-26T00:00:00", "closeddate": null, "title": "Response to SV30257", "doctype": "Site Updates/Notifications", "docsubtype": "Other", "decision": null, "description": "Dear Inspector\r\n\r\nBord na Mona would like to make the following response/submissions:\r\n\r\nThe licensee shall:\r\n\r\nRespond to observations raised in sections 2.1, 2.2 and 2.3 of the site visit report (Ref. SV30257), dated 03/03/2025;\r\n\r\n2.1 The scrap material are weirs/sluice gates and it is hoped to reuse these flow controls on other BNM bogs, so will be scheduled for removal, but currently do not constitute a risk to the environment.\r\n2.2 Please see attached Final Validation Report, including commentry on the monitoring results.\r\n2.3 As reported in the Independent Closure Audit conducted by Tobins, submitted to the Agency on the 21/09/2021 and assessed, the peat deposition site has performed as predicted since the last deposition in 2013 with no significant impacts on the groundwater or surface water. The downgradient rivers and bedrock aquifer are at good status under the WFD 2013-2018. The Munhin and Owenmore are not at risk based on the available EPA data.\r\n\r\nIn respect of soil and groundwater aspects of the site, based on the investigations, assessments\r\nat the site by TOBIN, we are of the opinion that the condition of the site is not causing or likely\r\nto cause off-site environmental pollution and the site is in a satisfactory state, and\r\nenvironmental liabilities identified in the CRAMP have been addressed.\r\n\r\n\r\nSubmit an EPR return for calendar year 2024, in accordance with condition 11.8. \r\n\r\nAn EPR has been submitted to the Agency on the 26/05/2025\r\n\r\nBord na Mona are of the opinion that it has now submitted all reasonable requests to the Agency since the application for surrender, including all monitoring returns, the ICA, Cert of Title, the application form and associated fees and now the final validation report.\r\n\r\nKind regards\r\n\r\nEnda McDonagh\r\nBord na Mona\r\n", "documentcategory": null, "complianceinvestigationid": null}"}

Authorisation: P0236
Organisation: Wellman International Limited
Site: Wellman International Limited
Report Year: 2024
Report Number: LRD0039206


Dear Reporter,

\\n

The EPA has reviewed the 2024 PRTR data submitted for your facility through the EPR online form in EDEN.

Please note the potential issues identified below.

\\n

PRTR ACTIVITY:

\\n
    \\n
  • PRTR Activity 4(e) was reported in 2024: \\\"Installations using a chemical or biological process for the production on an industrial scale of basic pharmaceutical products\\\". Please check.
    • \\n
\\n

RELEASES TO WATER:

\\n
    \\n
  • Cadmium 3,570 kg was reported in 2024.
    • \\n
  • Chromium 1,044 kg was reported in 2024. 
    • \\n
  • Copper 8,086 kg was reported in 2024. 
    • \\n
  • Lead 1,973 kg was reported in 2024.
    • \\n
  • Nickel 1,497 kg was reported in 2024.
    • \\n
  • Zinc 6,738 kg was reported in 2024.
    • \\n
\\n

 

\\n

Please review these items and respond within 5 working days to confirm if:

\\n

(a) the data is correct, providing an explanation; or
(b) the data requires correction.

Best regards,

\\n

PRTR Team. 

\\n



Please note that this EPA correspondence, and your response to it, will be published on the EPA’s Licence & Enforcement Access Portal (LEAP) which provides online public access to compliance and enforcement correspondence between the EPA and regulated operators.

\", \"correspondencetype\": \"Two Way Notification\"}"}

{"compliance_id": "714719fc-7d35-f011-a373-0050568a2d1a", "document_type": "Non Compliance", "document_url": "https://data.epa.ie/leap/api/v1/NonCompliance/byid?nc_id=714719fc-7d35-f011-a373-0050568a2d1a", "title": "", "description": "Any alterations to production processes must be undertaken with the prior agreement of the Agency. The licensee has installed additional production capacity without submitting details of the proposal to the Agency prior to construction occurring.\n\nThis is non-compliant with Condition 1.2 of the licence.  \n\nThe licensee is reminded that failure to comply with any condition attached to a licence is an offence.\n\n", "dateofnoncompliance": "2025-05-01T00:00:00", "dateofnotification": "2025-05-01T00:00:00"}"}

{"compliance_id": "ad65db82-453a-f011-a373-0050568a2d1a", "document_type": "Non Compliance", "document_url": "https://data.epa.ie/leap/api/v1/NonCompliance/byid?nc_id=ad65db82-453a-f011-a373-0050568a2d1a", "title": "", "description": "The licensee permitted a final effluent discharge which exceeded the emission limit values (ELV) for the following parameters on the following dates: 

- Total Nitrogen (5 mg/l ) - 06/05/2025 (6.2mg/l), 07/05/2025 (6.3 mg/l) & 13/05/2025 (6.6 mg/l)
- Nitrates (5 mg/l) - 06/05/2025 (7.2mg/l), 07/05/2025 (6.9 mg/l) & 19/05/2025 (6.5 mg/l)
- BOD (2 mg/l O2) - 06/05/2025 (3.1 mg/l O2)

The Agency carried out this site visit to follow up on the ongoing compliance investigation (CI) CI002183 which was opened in January 2025 regarding the management, control and operation of Kingspan Building Products Limited, Kingscourt Installation, Industrial Emissions (IE) Licence Reg. No P0065-01.

Kingspan Building Products Limited (the licensee) was found to be non-compliant with its licence at the time of the Agency site visit. A non-compliance was issued in relation to importing waste for on-site recovery without the agreement of the Agency. Additionally, an observation was raised regarding the foul network drainage map.

The issues raised require action to be taken by the licensee as specified in this report. In addition, the licensee is required to submit a response to the non-compliance(s) raised in this site visit report within 30 days of the date of issue of this report (using the \\u2018Make a Response\\u2019 link on the Site Visits page in EDEN).

{"compliance_id": "df04f3ba-dcbd-ef11-a324-0050568a66b2", "document_type": "Site Visit", "document_url": "https://data.epa.ie/leap/api/v1/SiteVisit/byid?sv_id=df04f3ba-dcbd-ef11-a324-0050568a66b2", "title": "", "description": "", "submission_date": "", "status": "Closed", "metadata": "{\"sitevisitid\": \"df04f3ba-dcbd-ef11-a324-0050568a66b2\", \"type\": \"Site Visit\", \"subject\": \"ORM Monitoring Visit (Planned 2025)\", \"reference\": \"SV31350\", \"status\": \"Closed\", \"licence_id\": \"56d3f180-fe92-44bf-9b41-ac0ff7f07302\", \"licenceprofile_id\": \"2800a316-42ce-e411-b3b4-0050568a69e2\", \"licenseesubmission_id\": null, \"visit_date\": \"2025-04-28T00:00:00\", \"report_issued_date\": \"2025-05-26T00:00:00\", \"compliance\": \"Yes\", \"summary\": \"

The Agency carried out this site visit as part of the Agency’s emissions monitoring programme. The monitoring report is attached.

\\n

An elevated result of 1,351 µS/cm for conductivity was recorded at groundwater monitoring point reference no. GW03. In addition, an elevated manganese concentration result of 450 µg/l was recorded at groundwater monitoring point reference no. GW04. These results are above the Agency’s recommended Interim Guidance Values (1,000 µS/cm for conductivity and 0.05 mg/l for manganese) for the protection of groundwater.

\\n

The licensee shall investigate these results in accordance with Condition 9.3.1 of the Licence and submit the findings, including the results of any further sampling and analysis, through EDEN under document type ‘Response to EPA Report’, within one month of the date of issue of this report.

{"compliance_id": "81f9eb10-da37-f011-a373-0050568a2d1a", "document_type": "Incident", "document_url": "https://data.epa.ie/leap/api/v1/Incident/byid?incident_id=81f9eb10-da37-f011-a373-0050568a2d1a", "title": "", "description": "Uncontrolled release from WWTP due to simultaneous electrical fault with both inlet foul pumps. The storm tank filled and overflowed while operations sourced and installed a temporary diesel pump which ceased the discharge at approximately 2pm on 22/05/2025. A contractor has attended site and has removed the two inlet pumps for assessment and repair and has also installed a temporary pump in the interim while repairs are being completed. The diesel pump has been taken offline but will remain on site on standby but was successful in maintaining operations and reducing the storm tank volume by approximately 50% by 9am on 23/05/2025. Operations are currently assessing the SCADA data and will provide more detail on estimated volumes discharged once this has been completed.", "submission_date": "", "status": "Open", "metadata": "{\"incidentid\": \"81f9eb10-da37-f011-a373-0050568a2d1a\", \"type\": \"Incident\", \"reference\": \"INCI030379\", \"subject\": \"Uncontrolled Release\", \"status\": \"Open\", \"licenceid\": \"121e76ab-203e-e111-ab87-0050568a69e2\", \"licenceprofileid\": \"c350d028-2914-480d-8f80-fee17e5a7cb9\", \"complianceinvestigationid\": null, \"incidentcategory\": \"1. {"compliance_id": "d22da689-b437-f011-a373-0050568a2d1a", "document_type": "Incident", "document_url": "https://data.epa.ie/leap/api/v1/Incident/byid?incident_id=d22da689-b437-f011-a373-0050568a2d1a", "title": "", "description": "A complaint was received on 19/05/2025 by email about a pollution incident in Bonmahon Waste Water Agglomeration. It occurred on 18/05/2025 at 15:00, involving an uncontrolled release to the River Mahon from the main septic tank at the public toilets. The report mentioned a cloudy discharge and rags at the outfall. The Local Authority carried out an initial check on 21/05/2025. No cloudy discharge or rags were found at that time of investigation. Additional information will be provided following further investigations. The complaint record will be updated accordingly in relation to EPA complaint COM020947. This incident and complainant will be updated thereafter.", "submission_date": "", "status": "Open", "metadata": "{\"incidentid\": \"d22da689-b437-f011-a373-0050568a2d1a\", \"type\": \"Incident\", \"reference\": \"INCI030375\", \"subject\": \"Uncontrolled Release\", \"status\": \"Open\", \"licenceid\": \"402276ab-203e-e111-ab87-0050568a69e2\", \"licenceprofileid\": \"65015c75-53cf-4608-a2e4-03d98f4d437e\", \"complianceinvestigationid\": \"a33630e5-8efb-ec11-a345-0050568a2d1a\", \"incidentcategory\": \"1. title: Completion notice mid May ploughing
metadata_json:
{"compliance_id": "14caa337-b037-f011-a373-0050568a2d1a", "document_type": "Site Updates/Notifications", "document_url": "https://data.epa.ie/leap/api/v1/LicenseeReturns/byid?lr_id=14caa337-b037-f011-a373-0050568a2d1a", "title": "Completion notice mid May ploughing", "description": "Dear Sir/Madam,

As per Condition 6.10 of Dumping at Sea Permit S0012-03, Port of Waterford hereby notifies the Environmental Protection Agency that we have completed our mid-May maintenance ploughing campaign (14th – 18th May). The areas worked were Cheekpoint Lower Bar and Cheekpoint Access Channel. 

The High Water tides during the campaign were as follows:

14th May – 4.2m 
15th May – 4.2m
16th May – 4.1m
17th May – 4.0m 
18th May – 3.9m


Sincerely,
Ian Moriarty", "submission_date": "", "status": "Closed", "metadata": "{"licenseereturnid": "14caa337-b037-f011-a373-0050568a2d1a", "type": "Site Updates/Notifications", "reference": "LR094621", "subject": "Site Updates/Notifications:Other", "status": "Closed", "licenceid": "a315b192-5ad4-42b7-a167-962202f5e2f8", "licenceprofileid": "d3e61a83-98a6-e611-8d41-0050568a69e2", "datereceived": "2025-05-23T00:00:00", "closeddate": "2025-05-23T00:00:00", "title": "Completion notice mid May ploughing", "doctype": "Site Updates/Notifications", "docsubtype": "Other", "decision": "Assessed", "description": "Dear Sir/Madam,\r\n\r\nAs per Condition 6.10 of Dumping at Sea Permit S0012-03, Port of Waterford hereby notifies the Environmental Protection Agency that we have completed our mid-May maintenance ploughing campaign (14th \u2013 18th May). The areas worked were Cheekpoint Lower Bar and Cheekpoint Access Channel. \r\n\r\nThe High Water tides during the campaign were as follows:\r\n\r\n14th May \u2013 4.2m \r\n15th May \u2013 4.2m\r\n16th May \u2013 4.1m\r\n17th May \u2013 4.0m \r\n18th May \u2013 3.9m\r\n\r\n\r\nSincerely,\r\nIan Moriarty", "documentcategory": null, "complianceinvestigationid": null}"}

{"compliance_id": "25089819-a6d1-ef11-a325-0050568a66b2", "document_type": "Site Visit", "document_url": "https://data.epa.ie/leap/api/v1/SiteVisit/byid?sv_id=25089819-a6d1-ef11-a325-0050568a66b2", "title": "", "description": "", "submission_date": "", "status": "Closed", "metadata": "{\"sitevisitid\": \"25089819-a6d1-ef11-a325-0050568a66b2\", \"type\": \"Site Visit\", \"subject\": \"Reg P0966-01 Annual Plan 2025\", \"reference\": \"SV31556\", \"status\": \"Closed\", \"licence_id\": \"7d02f917-ef35-e511-a5db-0050568a69e2\", \"licenceprofile_id\": \"1dcff5af-e935-e511-a5db-0050568a69e2\", \"licenseesubmission_id\": null, \"visit_date\": \"2025-04-30T00:00:00\", \"report_issued_date\": \"2025-05-23T00:00:00\", \"compliance\": \"No\", \"summary\": \"

The EPA carried out this site visit as part of the OEE annual site visit programme to evaluate the licensee's compliance with the requirements of the licence. The licensee was found to be non-compliant with its Licence at the time of the Agency site visit. The EPA is concerned with the licensees environmental management practices at the installation and the lack of an appropriately trained environmental manager at the site at the time of the inspection. Seven non-compliances were raised in relation to the slurry storage /wash water tank, storm water drainage and surface water contamination, bunding and material handling, waste management, monitoring, labelling and safe and permanent access and reporting. Two observations were recorded in relation to spillage and installation management.

\\n

The issues raised require action to be taken by the licensee as specified in this report.

\\n

The Licensee is required to submit a response to the non-compliance(s) raised in this site visit report within 21 days of the date of issue of this report (using the 'Make a Response' link on the Site Visits page in EDEN), as outlined in the Follow-up Actions section of this report).

\", \"announced\": \"No\", \"visittype\": \"OEE\", \"instigated_by\": \"Enforcement Plan Visit\", \"sampletaken\": \"No\", \"odourassessment\": \"No\", \"adourassessmentcompliant\": \"N/A\", \"licence_regno\": \"P0966-01\", \"profile_number\": \"P0966\"}"}

{"compliance_id": "61fdfdde-03f9-ef11-a325-0050568a66b2", "document_type": "Site Visit", "document_url": "https://data.epa.ie/leap/api/v1/SiteVisit/byid?sv_id=61fdfdde-03f9-ef11-a325-0050568a66b2", "title": "", "description": "", "submission_date": "", "status": "Closed", "metadata": "{\"sitevisitid\": \"61fdfdde-03f9-ef11-a325-0050568a66b2\", \"type\": \"Site Visit\", \"subject\": \"2025 Enforcement Plan - Coolatee\", \"reference\": \"SV32234\", \"status\": \"Closed\", \"licence_id\": \"e48b8a60-65fb-e111-9c56-0050568a69e2\", \"licenceprofile_id\": \"6f865725-2fdc-4094-9b68-a5319fb0b92c\", \"licenseesubmission_id\": null, \"visit_date\": \"2025-04-30T00:00:00\", \"report_issued_date\": \"2025-05-23T00:00:00\", \"compliance\": \"N/A\", \"summary\": \"

The Coolatee agglomeration was on the EPA’s list of urban waste water areas requiring improvements regarding no treatment/discharge of untreated waste water. UÉ completed the construction of a new WWTP at Coolatee in late 2024 and the Coolatee agglomeration was removed from the EPA’s list of urban waste water priority areas.

\\n

The EPA Inspector noted that the WWTP was performing satisfactorily and that the effluent quality was generally compliant when compared to relevant guide standards.

\\n

The EPA welcomes the provision of a new waste water treatment plant at Coolatee and the cessation of untreated discharges.

{"compliance_id": "65fdfdde-03f9-ef11-a325-0050568a66b2", "document_type": "Site Visit", "document_url": "https://data.epa.ie/leap/api/v1/SiteVisit/byid?sv_id=65fdfdde-03f9-ef11-a325-0050568a66b2", "title": "", "description": "", "submission_date": "", "status": "Closed", "metadata": "{\"sitevisitid\": \"65fdfdde-03f9-ef11-a325-0050568a66b2\", \"type\": \"Site Visit\", \"subject\": \"2025 Enforcement Plan - Killygordan\", \"reference\": \"SV32236\", \"status\": \"Closed\", \"licence_id\": \"381c76ab-203e-e111-ab87-0050568a69e2\", \"licenceprofile_id\": \"ea412169-2144-4769-94bd-437b5ea2a750\", \"licenseesubmission_id\": null, \"visit_date\": \"2025-04-30T00:00:00\", \"report_issued_date\": \"2025-05-23T00:00:00\", \"compliance\": \"N/A\", \"summary\": \"

Discharges from the Killygordon waste water works have been identified as a significant pressure putting the Finn (Donegal)_070 and Finn(Donegal)_080 water bodies at risk of not achieving their environmental objectives as required under the Water Framework Directive. There have been significant and reoccurring breaches of the emission limit value (ELV) for a range of parameters including total ammonia and BOD for the past number of months . The EPA has an open Compliance Investigation (ref:CI001967) in relation to the Killygordon waste water works.

\\n

The EPA Inspector noted that planned upgrade to the inlet works has been repeatedly delayed which is giving rise to significant operational issues, solids carry over to the effluent and breaches of emission limit values. In this regard, the EPA Inspector noted that Uisce Éireann did not have a detailed action plan with timelines in place. UÉ is required to report in full to the EPA on its work plans and timeframes to ensure that that the upgrade programme is completed without further delay. 

\\n

Also, Uisce Éireann is required to further develop the treatment process monitoring and control programme so as to provide for consistent compliance with the licence emission limits.

\\n

Uisce Éireann is required to respond to the EPA on the above matters through CI001967. 

\\n

The onus is on Uisce Éireann to comply with the conditions and requirements of the waste water discharge licence. Where non-compliance occurs, it is a matter for Uisce Éireann to ensure compliance is achieved as soon as possible. The EPA may, in line with its Compliance & Enforcement Policy, consider further enforcement action in relation to this matter. 

\\n

\", \"announced\": \"No\", \"visittype\": \"OEE\", \"instigated_by\": \"Enforcement Plan Visit\", \"sampletaken\": \"No\", \"odourassessment\": \"No\", \"adourassessmentcompliant\": \"N/A\", \"licence_regno\": \"D0518-01\", \"profile_number\": \"D0518\"}"}

Contractor attending site today 22nd May and an update will be provided once available. The set up in Dromahane is a tank with 3 sections, each with a designated RAS/WAS pump, one of these sections is without the pump the other two are operating fine. Kick in and kick out timings of the operating RAS pumps have been adjusted to reduce the impact from being down one pump temporarily, however carryover to river before adjustments made was likely. The exact start time of this is unconfirmed.\", \"otherrelevantinformation\": null, \"impactonenvironment\": \"Unknown\", \"activityinprogress\": \"normal \", \"dischargedetails\": null}"}

{"compliance_id": "bfdac2cd-1a37-f011-a373-0050568a2d1a", "document_type": "Incident", "document_url": "https://data.epa.ie/leap/api/v1/Incident/byid?incident_id=bfdac2cd-1a37-f011-a373-0050568a2d1a", "title": "", "description": "It was noted on the 16/05/2025 that both Venturi pumps in SBR 1 and SBR 2 had tripped due to an unknown mechanical/ electrical fault. The SCADA system showed the venturi pumps as running but the speed was at 0hz (set point 48hz). The venturi pumps assist the surface aerators in the DO levels in the SBR tanks. To note, surface aerators in each SBR were still operational, providing a degree of aeration while the venturi pumps tripped. Electrical contractors attended site on Monday the 19/05/2025 and were able to bring one of the venturi pumps (in SBR 2) back on- line at this time. On the 20/05/2025 contractors were able to by-pass a relay to bring the venturi pump in SBR 1 back online. A spare relay part will be required for SBR 1 venturi, to take it out of bypass mode.  Both venturi pumps are both back operational with operations at the plant to remain under review. To note, a compliance effluent sample dated the 08/05/2025 yielded compliant results; pH 8.0, ammonia 0.35, Ortho-P 0.66, BOD <2, COD 27, TSS 3 and TP 0.62. Once available, process monitoring results to be provided where available. Operations will continue to be monitored on site with a further update to be provided when available. Srowland WTP and Kildare County Council Environment Section were notified on the 20/05/2025 @ 11:55. \r\n", "submission_date": "", "status": "Open", "metadata": "{\"incidentid\": \"bfdac2cd-1a37-f011-a373-0050568a2d1a\", \"type\": \"Incident\", \"reference\": \"INCI030371\", \"subject\": \"Abatement equipment off-line\", \"status\": \"Open\", \"licenceid\": \"f81c76ab-203e-e111-ab87-0050568a69e2\", \"licenceprofileid\": \"02131887-10d8-4580-8eab-ae540d3b567c\", \"complianceinvestigationid\": null, \"incidentcategory\": \"1. title: P0011-06 RTO No. 4 Stack CEMS Parallel Measurements Report 2024
metadata_json:
{"compliance_id": "2c5c1633-2237-f011-a373-0050568a2d1a", "document_type": "Monitoring Returns", "document_url": "https://data.epa.ie/leap/api/v1/LicenseeReturns/byid?lr_id=2c5c1633-2237-f011-a373-0050568a2d1a", "title": "P0011-06 RTO No. 4 Stack CEMS Parallel Measurements Report 2024", "description": "Dear Ms. McMullen,  
  
As per licence condition 6.2, please find enclosed the 2024 report on the parallel measurements of the automated measuring systems (CEMS) at E.P. A2-3 Regenerative Thermal Oxidiser RTO No. 4 Stack at the MSD Ireland (Ballydine) facility.  
  
Condition 6.2 The automated measuring systems shall be subject to parallel measurements with the reference methods at least once per year. The licensee shall submit to the Agency an air monitoring report with the results of the parallel measurements.  
  
RTO No. 4 is a fume abatement system, and there is no liquid or solid waste incineration.  While noting that RTO No. 4 does not come under the Waste Incineration Directive, the parallel measurements and report have been completed in line with the requirements of EN 14181 and the EPA’s Air Guidance Note AG3.  
  
Please note that Thermal Oxidiser (TO) No. 3 has not been in operation since 2015 and its emission stack was dismantled and removed in 2022.  
  
Please revert to the undersigned if any further information is needed.  
  
Yours sincerely,  
					
David O'Gorman  
Sr Specialist, Safety and Environment  ", "submission_date": "", "status": "Open", "metadata": "{"licenseereturnid": "2c5c1633-2237-f011-a373-0050568a2d1a", "type": "Monitoring Returns", "reference": "LR094613", "subject": "Monitoring Returns:Air", "status": "Open", "licenceid": "27f2f1d0-6fa5-404b-b8f0-79c6213e09de", "licenceprofileid": "78c80169-1164-478f-8852-2e93e44eb406", "datereceived": "2025-05-22T00:00:00", "closeddate": null, "title": "P0011-06 RTO No. 4 Stack CEMS Parallel Measurements Report 2024", "doctype": "Monitoring Returns", "docsubtype": "Air", "decision": null, "description": "Dear Ms. McMullen,  \r\n  \r\nAs per licence condition 6.2, please find enclosed the 2024 report on the parallel measurements of the automated measuring systems (CEMS) at E.P. A2-3 Regenerative Thermal Oxidiser RTO No. 4 Stack at the MSD Ireland (Ballydine) facility.  \r\n  \r\nCondition 6.2 The automated measuring systems shall be subject to parallel measurements with the reference methods at least once per year. The licensee shall submit to the Agency an air monitoring report with the results of the parallel measurements.  \r\n  \r\nRTO No. 4 is a fume abatement system, and there is no liquid or solid waste incineration.  While noting that RTO No. 4 does not come under the Waste Incineration Directive, the parallel measurements and report have been completed in line with the requirements of EN 14181 and the EPA\u2019s Air Guidance Note AG3.  \r\n  \r\nPlease note that Thermal Oxidiser (TO) No. 3 has not been in operation since 2015 and its emission stack was dismantled and removed in 2022.  \r\n  \r\nPlease revert to the undersigned if any further information is needed.  \r\n  \r\nYours sincerely,  \r\n\t\t\t\t\t\r\nDavid O'Gorman  \r\nSr Specialist, Safety and Environment  ", "documentcategory": "Compliant", "complianceinvestigationid": null}"}

{"compliance_id": "66239ca2-b725-f011-a373-0050568a2d1a", "document_type": "Site Visit", "document_url": "https://data.epa.ie/leap/api/v1/SiteVisit/byid?sv_id=66239ca2-b725-f011-a373-0050568a2d1a", "title": "", "description": "", "submission_date": "", "status": "Closed", "metadata": "{\"sitevisitid\": \"66239ca2-b725-f011-a373-0050568a2d1a\", \"type\": \"Site Visit\", \"subject\": \"W0031-01, Incident follow up, 29/04/2025\", \"reference\": \"SV32536\", \"status\": \"Closed\", \"licence_id\": \"38c9e87d-7c61-e211-9eb5-0050568a69e2\", \"licenceprofile_id\": \"5ff95c14-6e51-49c6-8b88-0e0a54d5c705\", \"licenseesubmission_id\": null, \"visit_date\": \"2025-04-29T00:00:00\", \"report_issued_date\": \"2025-05-22T00:00:00\", \"compliance\": \"No\", \"summary\": \"

The Agency carried out this site visit to investigate a recent incident (Reference: INCI030220) in relation to unauthorised works at the facility.

\\n

 The purpose of this visit was to:

\\n
    \\n
  • gather additional information regarding the incident;
    • \\n
  • document any potential evidence of damage done to the final capping of Zone 1 of the landfill and associated landfill infrastructure; and
    • \\n
  • issue further instructions deemed necessary.  
    • \\n
\\n

The Licensee was found to be non-compliant with its Licence at the time of the Agency site visit. A non-compliance was recorded in relation to unauthorised landfill capping works.  

\\n

The issue raised requires action to be taken by the Licensee as specified in this report. 

\\n

The Licensee is required to submit a response to the non-compliance raised in this site visit report within 21 days of the date of issue of this report (using the ‘Make a Response’ link on the Site Visits page in EDEN), as outlined in the Follow-up Actions section of this report).

\\n

The Licensee is reminded that failure to comply with any Condition attached to a Licence or revised Licence is an offence.

{"compliance_id": "8291e732-5136-f011-a373-0050568a2d1a", "document_type": "Incident", "document_url": "https://data.epa.ie/leap/api/v1/Incident/byid?incident_id=8291e732-5136-f011-a373-0050568a2d1a", "title": "", "description": "The UV system, at Malahide WWTP, began failing in early 2021. A number of faults were noted when checks were carried out ahead of the bathing season. Replacement is required due to age / condition of this equipment item. Spare parts had been salvaged from second obsolete unit on site but all spares were exhausted at that time (01/02/2021). The UV system is operational but is considered a failing asset. Malahide has been referred to the National Shellfish assessment programme and is a candidate for further analysis during RC4. UV is required under the WWDL to operate during the bathing water season annually, it is noteworthy that Malahide is no long a designated bathing water. ", "submission_date": "", "status": "Open", "metadata": "{\"incidentid\": \"8291e732-5136-f011-a373-0050568a2d1a\", \"type\": \"Incident\", \"reference\": \"INCI030362\", \"subject\": \"Abatement equipment off-line\", \"status\": \"Open\", \"licenceid\": \"021d76ab-203e-e111-ab87-0050568a69e2\", \"licenceprofileid\": \"36c60599-2d02-4a10-8a2c-864bbe2586b6\", \"complianceinvestigationid\": null, \"incidentcategory\": \"1. {"compliance_id": "8de4c043-5436-f011-a373-0050568a2d1a", "document_type": "Incident", "document_url": "https://data.epa.ie/leap/api/v1/Incident/byid?incident_id=8de4c043-5436-f011-a373-0050568a2d1a", "title": "", "description": "Exceedance of CH4 and CO2 Trigger levels at various perimeter gas well locations ", "submission_date": "", "status": "Open", "metadata": "{\"incidentid\": \"8de4c043-5436-f011-a373-0050568a2d1a\", \"type\": \"Incident\", \"reference\": \"INCI030365\", \"subject\": \"Trigger Level Reached\", \"status\": \"Open\", \"licenceid\": \"e4c9e87d-7c61-e211-9eb5-0050568a69e2\", \"licenceprofileid\": \"834faacc-b351-4c60-8082-6efb31b90322\", \"complianceinvestigationid\": null, \"incidentcategory\": \"1. Minor\", \"nature\": \"Trigger Level Reached\", \"vulnerablereceptors\": \"No vulnerable receptors \", \"receptors\": \"No uncontrolled release\", \"likelihoodofreoccurence\": \"High\", \"likelycause\": \"Previous monitoring at the East Galway Landfill was carried out by White Young & Green on the 6th and 13th of December 2005, prior to the facility accepting waste. These two rounds of monitoring identified elevated methane gas levels at LG14, LG16 and LG18 and elevated carbon dioxide levels at monitoring locations LG6, LG6a, LG9, LG10, LG14, LG16 & LG18. The report on LFG monitoring carried out by WYG in December 2005 concluded the slightly high levels of CH4 and CO2 could be attributed to the large quantities of peat deposited in the area of the monitoring wells. A literature search demonstrates that the levels of carbon dioxide and methane measured in the landfill gas monitoring wells are attributed to the natural background levels from the continuous decay of organic peat. \", \"newrecurring\": \"Recurring\", \"datenotified\": \"2025-05-21T00:00:00\", \"closeddate\": null, \"approximatestart\": \"2025-05-20T10:00:00\", \"firstnoticed\": \"2025-05-21T10:20:00\", \"finishtime\": \"2025-05-20T13:00:00\", \"notifiedparties\": \"\", \"dischargepoint\": \"No\", \"emissionpointname\": \"n/a\", \"uncontrolledrelease\": \"n/a\", \"description\": \"Exceedance of CH4 and CO2 Trigger levels at various perimeter gas well locations \", \"otherrelevantinformation\": null, \"impactonenvironment\": \"No impact on Environment \", \"activityinprogress\": \"Environmental Monitoring on landfill as per license requirements \", \"dischargedetails\": \"Various gas migration locations surrounding landfill\"}"}

This is to be reviewed by both the Agency and the licensee.

title: Glenlough Bog Boundary Correction
document_type: Requests for Approval and Site Reports
metadata_json:
{"compliance_id": "e3113d2b-9a34-f011-a373-0050568a2d1a", "document_type": "Requests for Approval and Site Reports", "document_url": "https://data.epa.ie/leap/api/v1/LicenseeReturns/byid?lr_id=e3113d2b-9a34-f011-a373-0050568a2d1a", "title": "Glenlough Bog Boundary Correction", "description": "Dear Inspector

Please see attached letter and associated maps explaining the issues with the IPC boundary error at Glenlough Bog. The letter from the BnM Legal Department details the history behind the exchange of plots between BnM and Midland Irish Peat Moss Ltd, which commenced in 1983. However, these plots were included in error in BnM's application to the Agency for the Mountdillon IPC LIcence in 1999.
BnM never drained or extracted any peat from these plots now in the occupation and control of KlassMann Deilmann (Midland Irish Peat Moss Ltd) and as such request that the Agency agree to amending this error as part of the Licence boundary amendment packages being prepared for submission to the Agency later in 2025.


If you have any further queries please let me know.

Kind regards

Enda McDonagh
Bord na Mona

", "submission_date": "", "status": "Closed", "metadata": "{"licenseereturnid": "e3113d2b-9a34-f011-a373-0050568a2d1a", "type": "Requests for Approval and Site Reports", "reference": "LR094504", "subject": "Requests for Approval (RFA) and Site Reports:Other", "status": "Closed", "licenceid": "24c7e87d-7c61-e211-9eb5-0050568a69e2", "licenceprofileid": "f86701c7-076c-4369-8422-8adb6334959f", "datereceived": "2025-05-19T00:00:00", "closeddate": "2025-05-21T00:00:00", "title": "Glenlough Bog Boundary Correction", "doctype": "Requests for Approval (RFA) and Site Reports", "docsubtype": "Other", "decision": "Rejected", "description": "Dear Inspector\r\n\r\nPlease see attached letter and associated maps explaining the issues with the IPC boundary error at Glenlough Bog. The letter from the BnM Legal Department details the history behind the exchange of plots between BnM and Midland Irish Peat Moss Ltd, which commenced in 1983. However, these plots were included in error in BnM's application to the Agency for the Mountdillon IPC LIcence in 1999.\r\nBnM never drained or extracted any peat from these plots now in the occupation and control of KlassMann Deilmann (Midland Irish Peat Moss Ltd) and as such request that the Agency agree to amending this error as part of the Licence boundary amendment packages being prepared for submission to the Agency later in 2025.\r\n\r\n\r\nIf you have any further queries please let me know.\r\n\r\nKind regards\r\n\r\nEnda McDonagh\r\nBord na Mona\r\n\r\n", "documentcategory": null, "complianceinvestigationid": null}"}

The Agency carried out this site visit as part of the OEE annual site visit programme to evaluate Ipsen Manufacturing Ireland Limited (the licensee's) compliance with the requirements of the Industrial Emissions (IE) licence Reg. No P0117-02.

\\n

The licensee was found to be compliant with the conditions of its licence. Six observations were raised in relation to pipeline integrity, storm water visual inspections, spillages to storm water, bunding, the site drainage map, and carbon abatement system monitoring. The issues raised require action to be taken by the licensee as specified in this report.

The Castlemaginer (Castlemagner) agglomeration is served by one septic tank. The septic tank is overloaded and is not consistently achieving the effluent quality design criteria for septic tanks. 

\\n

It was stated that a new WWTP is to be built and an application for planning permission is proposed to be submitted in May 2025. 

\\n

Uisce Éireann are required to give the construction of a new wastewater treatment plant greater priority.

{"compliance_id": "3a508809-5235-f011-a373-0050568a2d1a", "document_type": "Incident", "document_url": "https://data.epa.ie/leap/api/v1/Incident/byid?incident_id=3a508809-5235-f011-a373-0050568a2d1a", "title": "", "description": "Notification of an intermittent release of treated effluent from a broken final effluent discharge pipe/ valve located on the network near Ticknevin, Co. Kildare (exact location to be confirmed). This release of treated effluent was to ground and to an adjacent roadway, which was reported to the UE call centre during the night of the 18/05/2025. Upon notification of this release, operatives attended the location on the 18/05/2025 at approx. 10:00pm to investigate. Operatives returned to the location during daylight hours on the 19/05/2025 at approx. 07:00am, with investigations determining a faulty air valve in the treated effluent discharge pipe resulted in this release of treated effluent from the network to the surrounding ground/ roadway. \r\nTo note, treated effluent is pumped from Derrinturn WWtP towards Ticknevin where this release occurred. To facilitate repairs to the network at this location, final effluent tankered from Derrinturn WWtP to allow access to the faulty valve to blank with a view to repairing where possible. To note, this discharge of treated effluent ceased at 07:30am on the 19/05/2025. There are currently no operational issues to note at Derrinturn WWtP with the plant operating as normal. A further update will be provided once details become available. ", "submission_date": "", "status": "Open", "metadata": "{\"incidentid\": \"3a508809-5235-f011-a373-0050568a2d1a\", \"type\": \"Incident\", \"reference\": \"INCI030346\", \"subject\": \"Uncontrolled Release\", \"status\": \"Open\", \"licenceid\": \"a81d76ab-203e-e111-ab87-0050568a69e2\", \"licenceprofileid\": \"52cd4ea6-db5d-4cf3-827d-bda41ff20ade\", \"complianceinvestigationid\": null, \"incidentcategory\": \"1. Minor\", \"nature\": \"Uncontrolled Release\", \"vulnerablereceptors\": \"n\\\\a\", \"receptors\": \"Ground\", \"likelihoodofreoccurence\": \"Low\", \"likelycause\": \"Broken Sewer Pipe\", \"newrecurring\": \"New\", \"datenotified\": \"2025-05-20T00:00:00\", \"closeddate\": null, \"approximatestart\": \"2025-05-18T22:00:00\", \"firstnoticed\": \"2025-05-18T22:00:00\", \"finishtime\": \"2025-05-19T07:30:00\", \"notifiedparties\": \"\", \"dischargepoint\": \"No\", \"emissionpointname\": \"n/a\", \"uncontrolledrelease\": \"Notification of an intermittent release of treated effluent from a broken final effluent discharge pipe/ valve located on the network near Ticknevin, Co. Kildare (exact location to be confirmed). This release of treated effluent was to ground and to an adjacent roadway, which was reported to the UE call centre during the night of the 18/05/2025. Upon notification of this release, operatives attended the location on the 18/05/2025 at approx. 10:00pm to investigate. Operatives returned to the location during daylight hours on the 19/05/2025 at approx. 07:00am, with investigations determining a faulty air valve in the treated effluent discharge pipe resulted in this release of treated effluent from the network to the surrounding ground/ roadway. \\r\\nTo note, treated effluent is pumped from Derrinturn WWtP towards Ticknevin where this release occurred. To facilitate repairs to the network at this location, final effluent tankered from Derrinturn WWtP to allow access to the faulty valve to blank with a view to repairing where possible. To note, this discharge of treated effluent ceased at 07:30am on the 19/05/2025. There are currently no operational issues to note at Derrinturn WWtP with the plant operating as normal. A further update will be provided once details become available. \", \"description\": \"Notification of an intermittent release of treated effluent from a broken final effluent discharge pipe/ valve located on the network near Ticknevin, Co. Kildare (exact location to be confirmed). This release of treated effluent was to ground and to an adjacent roadway, which was reported to the UE call centre during the night of the 18/05/2025. Upon notification of this release, operatives attended the location on the 18/05/2025 at approx. 10:00pm to investigate. Operatives returned to the location during daylight hours on the 19/05/2025 at approx. 07:00am, with investigations determining a faulty air valve in the treated effluent discharge pipe resulted in this release of treated effluent from the network to the surrounding ground/ roadway. \\r\\nTo note, treated effluent is pumped from Derrinturn WWtP towards Ticknevin where this release occurred. To facilitate repairs to the network at this location, final effluent tankered from Derrinturn WWtP to allow access to the faulty valve to blank with a view to repairing where possible. To note, this discharge of treated effluent ceased at 07:30am on the 19/05/2025. There are currently no operational issues to note at Derrinturn WWtP with the plant operating as normal. A further update will be provided once details become available. \", \"otherrelevantinformation\": \"This release of treated effluent to ground and to an adjacent roadway ceased at approx. 07:30am. To facilitate repairs to the network at this location, final effluent tankered from Derrinturn WWtP to allow access to the faulty valve to blank with a view to repairing where possible. There are currently no operational issues to note at Derrinturn WWtP with the plant operating as normal. A further update will be provided once details become available. \", \"impactonenvironment\": \"N/A. Release of treated effluent to ground from the network due to faulty valve. \", \"activityinprogress\": \"Normal activities. \", \"dischargedetails\": \"There was an intermittent, uncontrolled release of treated effluent from the network to a ditch and a roadway near Ticknevin, Co. Kildare (exact location to be confirmed). \"}"}

{"compliance_id": "a4a5cddf-6035-f011-a373-0050568a2d1a", "document_type": "Incident", "document_url": "https://data.epa.ie/leap/api/v1/Incident/byid?incident_id=a4a5cddf-6035-f011-a373-0050568a2d1a", "title": "", "description": "The pumped rising main adjacent to Moortown/Oldtown WWPS, Oldtown, burst on 19/05/2025. This was at a point where a repair was carried out, several years previously, by a contractor who damaged it while excavating the roadway for a water connection. This was identified by a damp patch on the roadway which was initially mistaken as a potable water leak.  The WWPS was shut off to reduce sewer escaping the closed system. A contractor was called out to carry out the repair and this was completed by 20.15 on 19/05/2025. As this is such a small catchment there was no need to tanker loads away as there was a enough holding space within the wet well of the WWPS for the short time the broken rising main was being fixed. Roadway was washed and disinfected after works.   ", "submission_date": "", "status": "Closed", "metadata": "{\"incidentid\": \"a4a5cddf-6035-f011-a373-0050568a2d1a\", \"type\": \"Incident\", \"reference\": \"INCI030348\", \"subject\": \"Uncontrolled Release\", \"status\": \"Closed\", \"licenceid\": \"7c1a76ab-203e-e111-ab87-0050568a69e2\", \"licenceprofileid\": \"4dc2ce14-4675-4759-a0fe-24003783ace3\", \"complianceinvestigationid\": null, \"incidentcategory\": \"1. title: MBM Test Programme External Monitoring - Round 3
metadata_json:
{"compliance_id": "10e21fbd-7e35-f011-a373-0050568a2d1a", "document_type": "Site Updates/Notifications", "document_url": "https://data.epa.ie/leap/api/v1/LicenseeReturns/byid?lr_id=10e21fbd-7e35-f011-a373-0050568a2d1a", "title": "MBM Test Programme External Monitoring - Round 3", "description": "Dear Mr Tynan,

It is the intention of Irish Cement Limerick to carry out the third round of external monitoring on the kiln stack as part of the approved Meat and Bonemeal (MBM) Test Programme next week commencing on the 26th May 2025. 

Should this monitoring be delayed or postponed for any reason, notification will be sent to the Agency.

If you have any queries, please don't hesitate in contacting me.

Kind Regards,
Eve Howard,
Irish Cement Ltd,
Limerick Works", "submission_date": "", "status": "Open", "metadata": "{"licenseereturnid": "10e21fbd-7e35-f011-a373-0050568a2d1a", "type": "Site Updates/Notifications", "reference": "LR094545", "subject": "Site Updates/Notifications:Other", "status": "Open", "licenceid": "2bfff72f-b3f0-413e-9891-dc788b345344", "licenceprofileid": "a20c2008-1c83-446a-957a-1d1c34b9b5f2", "datereceived": "2025-05-20T00:00:00", "closeddate": null, "title": "MBM Test Programme External Monitoring - Round 3", "doctype": "Site Updates/Notifications", "docsubtype": "Other", "decision": "Assessed", "description": "Dear Mr Tynan,\r\n\r\nIt is the intention of Irish Cement Limerick to carry out the third round of external monitoring on the kiln stack as part of the approved Meat and Bonemeal (MBM) Test Programme next week commencing on the 26th May 2025. \r\n\r\nShould this monitoring be delayed or postponed for any reason, notification will be sent to the Agency.\r\n\r\nIf you have any queries, please don't hesitate in contacting me.\r\n\r\nKind Regards,\r\nEve Howard,\r\nIrish Cement Ltd,\r\nLimerick Works", "documentcategory": null, "complianceinvestigationid": null}"}

title: Response to Section 4.3 of SV31573
metadata_json: {"compliance_id": "30e05eb2-5835-f011-a373-0050568a2d1a", "document_type": "Site Updates/Notifications", "document_url": "https://data.epa.ie/leap/api/v1/LicenseeReturns/byid?lr_id=30e05eb2-5835-f011-a373-0050568a2d1a", "title": "Response to Section 4.3 of SV31573", "description": "Under section 4.3 of SV31573 the Agency reference a request by the Agency for clarification on the description of the combustibility of organic fines in the 2021 Fire Water Retention Report (LR063772).  The original description of the organic fines material in Licence Return Ref. LR063772 was non-combustible.  The Fire Water Retention report was subsequently revised and resubmitted to the Agency on 30/06/2022 under licence return LR069006 where the material was reclassified in the report as Low Risk Combustible material. From our understanding the revised description was accepted and the query was closed. ", "submission_date": "", "status": "Open", "metadata": "{\"licenseereturnid\": \"30e05eb2-5835-f011-a373-0050568a2d1a\", \"type\": \"Site Updates/Notifications\", \"reference\": \"LR094535\", \"subject\": \"Site Updates/Notifications:Response to EPA Report\", \"status\": \"Open\", \"licenceid\": \"1a913829-0e4d-46c7-9e31-cd73ba4082d0\", \"licenceprofileid\": \"fe25a7be-b6b1-4353-a8b8-5d5ce20c15dd\", \"datereceived\": \"2025-05-20T00:00:00\", \"closeddate\": null, \"title\": \"Response to Section 4.3 of SV31573\", \"doctype\": \"Site Updates/Notifications\", \"docsubtype\": \"Response to EPA Report\", \"decision\": \"Assessed\", \"description\": \"Under section 4.3 of SV31573 the Agency reference a request by the Agency for clarification on the description of the combustibility of organic fines in the 2021 Fire Water Retention Report (LR063772).  The original description of the organic fines material in Licence Return Ref. LR063772 was non-combustible.  The Fire Water Retention report was subsequently revised and resubmitted to the Agency on 30/06/2022 under licence return LR069006 where the material was reclassified in the report as Low Risk Combustible material. From our understanding the revised description was accepted and the query was closed. \", \"documentcategory\": null, \"complianceinvestigationid\": null}"}

title: Surrender Application
metadata_json:
{"compliance_id": "c093c8b9-8435-f011-a373-0050568a2d1a", "document_type": "Site Closure and Surrender", "document_url": "https://data.epa.ie/leap/api/v1/LicenseeReturns/byid?lr_id=c093c8b9-8435-f011-a373-0050568a2d1a", "title": "Surrender Application ", "description": "

Dear Chloe,
Please find attached our surrender application, along with the IED map, folio, and supporting documents.
Based on our calculations, the correct fee for this process is €4,444. Could you kindly confirm this amount and request the relevant team to issue an invoice to Soltec?
I appreciate your assistance and look forward to your confirmation.
Best regards,
David Corcoran

Nonetheless, the licensee was found to be non-compliant with their license at the time of the inspection.

\\n
