title: P0366-02, ELV exceedences at air emission point reference no. A1-1
metadata_json:
{"compliance_id": "aa05d15a-822a-f011-a373-0050568a2d1a", "document_type": "Compliance Investigation", "document_url": "https://data.epa.ie/leap/api/v1/Ci/byid?ci_id=aa05d15a-822a-f011-a373-0050568a2d1a", "title": "P0366-02, ELV exceedences at air emission point reference no. A1-1", "description": "The main environmental issues in the management of the facility are:
i.	Non-compliant air emissions from the bio-unit
ii.	Bio-unit maintenance
iii.	Odour management

On 12/09/2024, Element Materials Technology, on behalf of the Agency conducted an air monitoring event at Alert Packaging Limited as part of the Agency’s routine air emissions monitoring programme. Monitoring at emission point reference number A-1 (scrubber column of bio-unit) recorded an overall average Total VOCs (as Carbon) of 303mg/m³, exceeding the emission limit value of 100mg/m3, and 1-hour averages of 316.6mg/m3 and 312.7mg/m3, exceeding the emission limit value of 150mg/m3 as shown in table 1 below. This is non-compliant with Condition 5.1. 

The test programme submitted by Alert Packaging Limited in response to SV32103 was assessed and was found to not be in accordance with Agency published guidance. This Compliance Action is to ensure that a suitable test programme is in place to ensure compliance with the emission limit values at air emission point reference no. A1-1. Failure of the licensee to have an appropriate test programme in place for the bio-unit is a contributing factor to the exceedance of emission limit values, the failure to maintain the bio-unit appropriately and the off-site odour impact.", "submission_date": "", "status": "Open", "metadata": "{"complianceinvestigationid": "aa05d15a-822a-f011-a373-0050568a2d1a", "reference": "CI002203", "subject": "Odour / Smells", "status": "Open", "licenceid": "68c6e87d-7c61-e211-9eb5-0050568a69e2", "licenceprofileid": "359b4db8-d712-4f91-bbbb-25f7d0633ca6", "responselevel": "High", "title": "P0366-02, ELV exceedences at air emission point reference no. A1-1", "origin": "Instances of Non compliance", "receptors": "Air", "description": "The main environmental issues in the management of the facility are:\ni.\tNon-compliant air emissions from the bio-unit\nii.\tBio-unit maintenance\niii.\tOdour management\n\nOn 12/09/2024, Element Materials Technology, on behalf of the Agency conducted an air monitoring event at Alert Packaging Limited as part of the Agency\u2019s routine air emissions monitoring programme. Monitoring at emission point reference number A-1 (scrubber column of bio-unit) recorded an overall average Total VOCs (as Carbon) of 303mg/m\u00b3, exceeding the emission limit value of 100mg/m3, and 1-hour averages of 316.6mg/m3 and 312.7mg/m3, exceeding the emission limit value of 150mg/m3 as shown in table 1 below. This is non-compliant with Condition 5.1. \n\nThe test programme submitted by Alert Packaging Limited in response to SV32103 was assessed and was found to not be in accordance with Agency published guidance. This Compliance Action is to ensure that a suitable test programme is in place to ensure compliance with the emission limit values at air emission point reference no. A1-1. Failure of the licensee to have an appropriate test programme in place for the bio-unit is a contributing factor to the exceedance of emission limit values, the failure to maintain the bio-unit appropriately and the off-site odour impact.", "closedate": null, "dateraised": "2025-05-19T00:00:00", "licence_regno": "P0366-02"}"}

Minor\", \"nature\": \"Detetion of trace E.Coli in BH2 \", \"vulnerablereceptors\": \"Vulnerable receptors include the local groundwater.\\r\\nAccording to the National Groundwater Vulnerability Ireland GSI source, the groundwater is categorised as 'Moderate' vulnerability.\\r\\nThe ground waterbody (IE SW G 037 - Glenville) latest WFD status is 'good'\\r\\nOther vulnerable receptors include the Shanowennadrimina stream (EPA code 18S02) which lies approximatley 300m from the site. {"compliance_id": "82ca76c5-bb34-f011-a373-0050568a2d1a", "document_type": "Incident", "document_url": "https://data.epa.ie/leap/api/v1/Incident/byid?incident_id=82ca76c5-bb34-f011-a373-0050568a2d1a", "title": "", "description": "Exceedance of Schedule E: Standards of Digestate Quality parameters in Table E.2 - Maximum Metal Concentration Limits: Copper 201 Mg/kg dry matter Zinc 593 Mg/kg dry matter", "submission_date": "", "status": "Open", "metadata": "{\"incidentid\": \"82ca76c5-bb34-f011-a373-0050568a2d1a\", \"type\": \"Incident\", \"reference\": \"INCI030340\", \"subject\": \"Breach of ELV\", \"status\": \"Open\", \"licenceid\": \"89703cff-9bb0-e611-8d41-0050568a69e2\", \"licenceprofileid\": \"e334799f-9bb0-e611-8d41-0050568a69e2\", \"complianceinvestigationid\": \"d859c80a-dc3a-ef11-a368-0050568a2d1a\", \"incidentcategory\": \"1. Minor\", \"nature\": \"Breach of ELV\", \"vulnerablereceptors\": \"none\", \"receptors\": \"Ground\", \"likelihoodofreoccurence\": \"Medium\", \"likelycause\": \"As expressed to the Agency on numerous occasions the cause of the breaches in heavy metals is down to a flawed metric and having to express a liquid in mg/kg of DM in conjunction with TAG operating a low DM feedstock. The license makes reference to the use of digestate as a soil improver, which in turn is defined in paragraph 5 of Product Function Category (PFC) 3 of EU 2019/1009. Which states \\u201cAn organic soil improver shall contain 20% or more dry matter With results having to be expressed in mg/kg of DM, the laboratory has to express results in ug/l and then divide by DM Result multiplied by 100 divided by 1000 to get results in mg/kg of DM as per license conditions. This is a flawed metric and TAG feedstocks are of a low DM content so the lower the DM the higher the result.\", \"newrecurring\": \"Recurring\", \"datenotified\": \"2025-05-19T00:00:00\", \"closeddate\": null, \"approximatestart\": \"2025-04-22T11:15:00\", \"firstnoticed\": \"2025-05-19T14:10:00\", \"finishtime\": null, \"notifiedparties\": \"\", \"dischargepoint\": \"No\", \"emissionpointname\": \"n/a\", \"uncontrolledrelease\": \"n/a\", \"description\": \"Exceedance of Schedule E: Standards of Digestate Quality parameters in Table E.2 - Maximum Metal Concentration Limits: Copper 201 Mg/kg dry matter Zinc 593 Mg/kg dry matter\", \"otherrelevantinformation\": null, \"impactonenvironment\": \"minor\", \"activityinprogress\": \"Normal activities\", \"dischargedetails\": \"Tmoleague agri gen pasteurisation sampling point post pasteurisation\"}"}

{"compliance_id": "dd6694f0-ce34-f011-a373-0050568a2d1a", "document_type": "Incident", "document_url": "https://data.epa.ie/leap/api/v1/Incident/byid?incident_id=dd6694f0-ce34-f011-a373-0050568a2d1a", "title": "", "description": "There was burst in the rising main overnight between Tulla Road Pump Station and Ennis North WWTP.  The burst in the pipe was on a bridge over the River Fergus. The burst occurred at approx. 10pm last night, May 18th and pumps at Tulla PS were shut off at 10.15pm, the pipes were isolated and valves shut off on both sides. Tankering from Tulla Road pump station to Francis Street PS commenced at 8am this morning. There are two tankers in rotation. The discharge from the pipe has greatly reduced however it is still leaking slightly, which may be due to infiltration as the discharge is clear. There is limited capacity at Tulla Road PS and the foul tank has been filling and the tankers are struggling to keep up. Asset Operations are actively trying to get more tankers on site to help alleviate the pressure. Unfortunately, the foul tank had filled up and spilled over into the storm tank which discharged via the SWO for a period of approx. 10 to 15 minutes this afternoon at approx. 3pm. Contractors have been to site and it will not be an easy fix, they are working to come to a solution at present as the pipe break is proving challenging to repair. Further details, including volumes etc. will be provided as soon as it becomes available.", "submission_date": "", "status": "Open", "metadata": "{\"incidentid\": \"dd6694f0-ce34-f011-a373-0050568a2d1a\", \"type\": \"Incident\", \"reference\": \"INCI030345\", \"subject\": \"Uncontrolled Release\", \"status\": \"Open\", \"licenceid\": \"901f76ab-203e-e111-ab87-0050568a69e2\", \"licenceprofileid\": \"68596850-0576-46c6-9dd6-4e973d815bd4\", \"complianceinvestigationid\": null, \"incidentcategory\": \"2. The burst in the pipe was on a bridge over the River Fergus. The burst occurred at approx. 10pm last night, May 18th and pumps at Tulla PS were shut off at 10.15pm, the pipes were isolated and valves shut off on both sides. Tankering from Tulla Road pump station to Francis Street PS commenced at 8am this morning. There are two tankers in rotation. The discharge from the pipe has greatly reduced however it is still leaking slightly, which may be due to infiltration as the discharge is clear. There is limited capacity at Tulla Road PS and the foul tank has been filling and the tankers are struggling to keep up. Asset Operations are actively trying to get more tankers on site to help alleviate the pressure. {"compliance_id": "fb7970fe-8334-f011-a373-0050568a2d1a", "document_type": "Incident", "document_url": "https://data.epa.ie/leap/api/v1/Incident/byid?incident_id=fb7970fe-8334-f011-a373-0050568a2d1a", "title": "", "description": "Malfunction of RTO fan motor on 17 May 2025 and bypass activated. Initially bypass occurred at 16th May 2025 for 50 minutes due to RTO fan error, possibly overheating of motor, it \r\nwas reset and restarted and operational until 07:27am on  17th May when there was full motor failure in the fan unit. Maintenance on site on Sat 17th replaced the motor.", "submission_date": "", "status": "Closed", "metadata": "{\"incidentid\": \"fb7970fe-8334-f011-a373-0050568a2d1a\", \"type\": \"Incident\", \"reference\": \"INCI030332\", \"subject\": \"Abatement equipment off-line\", \"status\": \"Closed\", \"licenceid\": \"81098567-1a89-45c0-a344-0668da16097f\", \"licenceprofileid\": \"77e11786-8292-4f95-8724-32e3e816d005\", \"complianceinvestigationid\": null, \"incidentcategory\": \"1. {"compliance_id": "6181c2ff-9934-f011-a373-0050568a2d1a", "document_type": "EPA Initiated Correspondence", "document_url": "https://data.epa.ie/leap/api/v1/MeetingCorrespondence/epainiciatedcorrespondencebyid?epainitiatedcorrespondence_id=6181c2ff-9934-f011-a373-0050568a2d1a", "title": "", "description": "", "submission_date": "", "status": "Closed", "metadata": "{\"epainitiatedcorrespondenceid\": \"6181c2ff-9934-f011-a373-0050568a2d1a\", \"type\": \"EPA Initiated Correspondence\", \"licenceid\": \"e0178521-cd94-e411-b3b4-0050568a69e2\", \"licenceprofileid\": \"5f803ada-cc94-e411-b3b4-0050568a69e2\", \"licenseesubmissionid\": null, \"reference\": \"N/A\", \"subject\": \"W0281-01, Sur07 - Notification of Exit Audit\", \"datesubmitted\": \"2025-05-19T00:00:00\", \"duedate\": null, \"status\": \"Closed\", \"licensingnotification\": \"

W0281-01, Sur07 - Notification of Exit Audit under Section 95[3] of the Environmental Protection Agency Act 1992

\\n

Dear Licensee,

\\n

As part of the enforcement of IE licence W0281-01, Agency Inspectors will be visiting the above facility at 12:00 on 21/02/2025 to carry out an Exit Audit as per Section 95[3] of the Environmental Protection Act 1992, as amended.  To facilitate an effective and efficient audit process, it is requested that the following be provided:

\\n
    \\n
  • A contact person to provide information on the site and assist during inspection of the site; and
    • \\n
  • Access to facilities and reference material pertaining to IE Licence W0281-01.
    • \\n
\\n

 The Exit Audit will examine, but may not be limited to, the following:

\\n
    \\n
  1. The findings of the Independent Closure Audit Report;
    2. \\n
  2. Groundwater/surface water/soil contamination;
    3. \\n
  3. Underground/overground Fuel/Chemical/Other storage/structures & bunding;
    4. \\n
  4. Waste management;
    5. \\n
  5. Current environmental legislative obligations;
    6. \\n
  6. Status of enforcement actions (e.g. Requests for Information, Notifications of Non-Compliances);
    7. \\n
  7. Outstanding reports/proposals required under the IE licence; and
    8. \\n
  8. Future ownership, contact details and security measures for the site.
    9. \\n
\\n

Please quote the above reference in future correspondence in relation to this matter.

\\n

If you have any queries, please contact me on the below number or email.

\\n

Kind Regards,

\\n

Aisling Carroll

\\n

Inspector - Waste Enforcement, Office of Environmental Enforcement

\\n

Mobile: 083-0121418

\\n

Email: a.carroll@epa.ie

\", \"correspondencetype\": \"One Way Notification\"}"}

{"compliance_id": "31fefdde-03f9-ef11-a325-0050568a66b2", "document_type": "Site Visit", "document_url": "https://data.epa.ie/leap/api/v1/SiteVisit/byid?sv_id=31fefdde-03f9-ef11-a325-0050568a66b2", "title": "", "description": "", "submission_date": "", "status": "Closed", "metadata": "{\"sitevisitid\": \"31fefdde-03f9-ef11-a325-0050568a66b2\", \"type\": \"Site Visit\", \"subject\": \"2025 Enforcement Plan - Baile na nGall\", \"reference\": \"SV32338\", \"status\": \"Closed\", \"licence_id\": \"5a1e76ab-203e-e111-ab87-0050568a69e2\", \"licenceprofile_id\": \"794485f0-6190-4858-aacd-1001f377f294\", \"licenseesubmission_id\": null, \"visit_date\": \"2025-05-07T00:00:00\", \"report_issued_date\": \"2025-05-19T00:00:00\", \"compliance\": \"N/A\", \"summary\": \"

This site inspection was conducted at Baile na nGall Waste Water Treatment Plant (WWTP) to check compliance with the Waste Water Discharge Licence (WWDL) D0358-01.

The site visit found that the treatment plant is fully compliant with its licensed Emission Limit Values. However, there are significant ongoing issues with unauthorised secondary discharges from the network in the Baile na nGall agglomeration. To address these issues, network upgrade works and installation of a new Stormwater Storage Tank at the WWTP are underway and scheduled to be completed in Spring 2026.

The onus is on Uisce \\u00c9ireann to take all steps necessary to ensure compliance with the requirements of the waste water discharge licence.

\", \"announced\": \"Yes\", \"visittype\": \"OEE\", \"instigated_by\": \"Enforcement Plan Visit\", \"sampletaken\": \"No\", \"odourassessment\": \"No\", \"adourassessmentcompliant\": \"N/A\", \"licence_regno\": \"D0358-01\", \"profile_number\": \"D0358\"}"}

This site inspection was conducted at Cappoquin Waste Water Treatment Plant (WWTP) to check compliance with the Waste Water Discharge Licence (WWDL) D0272-01.

\\n

The site visit found that the treatment plant is fully compliant with its licensed Emission Limit Values. However, operational issues were observed, which may impact treatment efficiency or result in solid carry-over events to the Upper Blackwater Estuary, in relation to:

\\n
    \\n
  • Excessive scum/foam present in the SBRs.
    • \\n
  • Sludge Volume Index (SVI) in excess of 200ml/g throughout 2024 and 2025-to-date.
    • \\n
  • Sludge import acceptance potentially preventing adequate wasting at the plant.
    • \\n
\\n

The onus is on Uisce Éireann to take all steps necessary to ensure compliance with the requirements of the waste water discharge licence.

Uisce \\u00c9ireann did not satisfy the requirements of the waste water discharge licence at the time of the site visit because the concentration of suspended solids in the effluent sample taken during the site visit exceeded the limit set in the licence. Uisce \\u00c9ireann is required to log the breach of the suspended solids limit as an incident on EDEN and take all steps necessary to avoid a recurrence of this incident.

This site visit report identifies areas where Uisce \\u00c9ireann did not satisfy the requirements of the waste water discharge licence. The following items in particular should be addressed:

- Ensure the flow meter is calibrated. Submit the last the flow meter calibration certificate and the certificate associated with the calibration required by way of licensee return.

- Ensure the fine screen is returned to operation without delay.

- Ensure the clarifier is being cleaned and maintained so that there is no carry over of solids/algae to the final discharge.

{"compliance_id": "5e6b249a-dd0a-f011-a373-0050568a2d1a", "document_type": "Site Visit", "document_url": "https://data.epa.ie/leap/api/v1/SiteVisit/byid?sv_id=5e6b249a-dd0a-f011-a373-0050568a2d1a", "title": "", "description": "", "submission_date": "", "status": "Closed", "metadata": "{\"sitevisitid\": \"5e6b249a-dd0a-f011-a373-0050568a2d1a\", \"type\": \"Site Visit\", \"subject\": \"W0277 Exit audit\", \"reference\": \"SV32433\", \"status\": \"Closed\", \"licence_id\": \"e04f30c0-a3b9-4e94-b87f-d343bf72cceb\", \"licenceprofile_id\": \"2800a316-42ce-e411-b3b4-0050568a69e2\", \"licenseesubmission_id\": null, \"visit_date\": \"2025-03-27T00:00:00\", \"report_issued_date\": \"2025-05-16T00:00:00\", \"compliance\": \"Yes\", \"summary\": \"

The purpose of the site visit was to complete an exit audit of an area of the Roadstone Limited\\u2019s Huntstown Inert Waste Recover Facility, Waste Licence Reg. No. W0277-04, which Roadstone Limited (the licensee) proposes to remove from the licensed boundary (LR065512 refers).

The area referred to is the 'West Quarry' which was partially excavated and then backfilled with inert soil and stone waste imported from local construction and development projects. The lands to be removed extend to 12.8 hectares of the current overall licensed area.    

The scope of the exit audit included an overview of the following having regard to the Waste Licence conditions and the EPA guidance on management of contaminated land and groundwater at EPA licensed sites:

  • An assessment of the apparent physical condition of the subject area to be removed from within the licensed site boundary;
  • Review of documentation relating to site investigations and the proposed licence boundary change, and
  • An assessment of completed work with regards to the sites Closure Restoration and Aftercare Management Plan (CRAMP) and other relevant licence conditions. 

The Independent Closure Audit (ICA) and Detailed Quantitative Risk Assessment (DQRA), including additional information provided, were used as the principal audit documents.   

Based on the findings of the exit audit and a review of the associated documentation, it is considered that, whilst residual contamination has been identified, the risk the contamination poses to the environment is low. 

Nothing in this report shall be construed as relieving the current owner or any future purchaser/leaser of the site from its/their present or future liabilities in relation to environmental or human health matters connected with this site, whether arising from or connected with Waste Licence Reg. No. W0277-04 or otherwise.

One observation was raised relating to groundwater monitoring. In order for the Agency to progress the proposed licence boundary change the Agency requires the licensee to submit the updated groundwater monitoring results requested. 

\", \"announced\": \"Yes\", \"visittype\": \"OEE\", \"instigated_by\": \"Independent Closure Audit\", \"sampletaken\": \"No\", \"odourassessment\": \"No\", \"adourassessmentcompliant\": \"N/A\", \"licence_regno\": \"W0277-03\", \"profile_number\": \"W0277\"}"}

title: Replenishment of sand Filter media Rochfortbridge WWTP
metadata_json:
{"compliance_id": "a4c2dd6f-152c-f011-a373-0050568a2d1a", "document_type": "Site Updates/Notifications", "document_url": "https://data.epa.ie/leap/api/v1/LicenseeReturns/byid?lr_id=a4c2dd6f-152c-f011-a373-0050568a2d1a", "title": "Replenishment of sand Filter media Rochfortbridge WWTP ", "description": "Dear Inspector, 

Uisce Eireann wish to advise the agency of planned maintenance works on the sand filter at Rochfortbridge WWTP.
These works are due to commence on the 13/05/25. The sand filter will be taken out of commission for approximately 2-3 weeks to carry out the works. During this time, the effluent will be directly discharged from the final clarifier.
Sludge levels will maintained at target levels prior to work commencing. Additional onsite sampling will be carried out to ensure compliance with WWDL ELVs along with continued monitoring of the of the ferric and caustic dosing systems.

Kind Regards

E/M Wastewater Compliance.", "submission_date": "", "status": "Open", "metadata": "{"licenseereturnid": "a4c2dd6f-152c-f011-a373-0050568a2d1a", "type": "Site Updates/Notifications", "reference": "LR094293", "subject": "Site Updates/Notifications:Infrastructure Update", "status": "Open", "licenceid": "c81d76ab-203e-e111-ab87-0050568a69e2", "licenceprofileid": "00fa673b-9783-429f-b5f7-5be382156e67", "datereceived": "2025-05-08T00:00:00", "closeddate": null, "title": "Replenishment of sand Filter media Rochfortbridge WWTP ", "doctype": "Site Updates/Notifications", "docsubtype": "Infrastructure Update", "decision": null, "description": "Dear Inspector, \r\n\r\nUisce Eireann wish to advise the agency of planned maintenance works on the sand filter at Rochfortbridge WWTP.\r\nThese works are due to commence on the 13/05/25. The sand filter will be taken out of commission for approximately 2-3 weeks to carry out the works. During this time, the effluent will be directly discharged from the final clarifier.\r\nSludge levels will maintained at target levels prior to work commencing. Additional onsite sampling will be carried out to ensure compliance with WWDL ELVs along with continued monitoring of the of the ferric and caustic dosing systems.\r\n\r\nKind Regards\r\n\r\nE/M Wastewater Compliance.", "documentcategory": null, "complianceinvestigationid": null}"}

title: License Surrender Application Query
metadata_json:
{"compliance_id": "2529a815-ca25-f011-a373-0050568a2d1a", "document_type": "Site Updates/Notifications", "document_url": "https://data.epa.ie/leap/api/v1/LicenseeReturns/byid?lr_id=2529a815-ca25-f011-a373-0050568a2d1a", "title": "License Surrender Application Query", "description": "To whom it concerns,

I am submitting a query on behalf of my client Sleever International Limited. The query relates to their application for license surrender which Sleever have made the EPA aware of. In the EPA guidance for license surrender, it states the licensee is to implement the agreed  Closure, Restoration and Aftercare Management Plan (CRAMP), Residuals Management Plan (RMP), Decommissioning Plan (DMP) or Independent Closure Audit (ICA). Sleever have an RMP, however this is from 2006 and is outdated. Would you be able to provide some guidance as to which document will need to accompany the surrender application. 

For context, operations at the site will still continue but the gravure press (A2-01) has been decommissioned and removed from the site and the new UV Flexo technology has been installed and operational. At this point it can be proved that the solvent usage when annualized will be well below 10 tonnes.

Your advice is appreciated.

Kind regards,
Rebecca Stokes (Environmental Consultant at Environmental Efficiency)
", "submission_date": "", "status": "Open", "metadata": "{"licenseereturnid": "2529a815-ca25-f011-a373-0050568a2d1a", "type": "Site Updates/Notifications", "reference": "LR094076", "subject": "Site Updates/Notifications:Other", "status": "Open", "licenceid": "b0c7e87d-7c61-e211-9eb5-0050568a69e2", "licenceprofileid": "9fd4c177-829b-4f7b-910e-8c811caaeebc", "datereceived": "2025-04-30T00:00:00", "closeddate": null, "title": "License Surrender Application Query", "doctype": "Site Updates/Notifications", "docsubtype": "Other", "decision": null, "description": "To whom it concerns,\r\n\r\nI am submitting a query on behalf of my client Sleever International Limited. The query relates to their application for license surrender which Sleever have made the EPA aware of. In the EPA guidance for license surrender, it states the licensee is to implement the agreed  Closure, Restoration and Aftercare Management Plan (CRAMP), Residuals Management Plan (RMP), Decommissioning Plan (DMP) or Independent Closure Audit (ICA). Sleever have an RMP, however this is from 2006 and is outdated. Would you be able to provide some guidance as to which document will need to accompany the surrender application. \r\n\r\nFor context, operations at the site will still continue but the gravure press (A2-01) has been decommissioned and removed from the site and the new UV Flexo technology has been installed and operational. At this point it can be proved that the solvent usage when annualized will be well below 10 tonnes.\r\n\r\nYour advice is appreciated.\r\n\r\nKind regards,\r\nRebecca Stokes (Environmental Consultant at Environmental Efficiency)\r\n", "documentcategory": null, "complianceinvestigationid": null}"}

{"compliance_id": "1764eef2-3a0a-4664-9226-0fb5813f8c14", "document_type": "Meeting", "document_url": "https://data.epa.ie/leap/api/v1/MeetingCorrespondence/meetingbyid?meeting_id=1764eef2-3a0a-4664-9226-0fb5813f8c14", "title": "", "description": "", "submission_date": "", "status": "Closed", "metadata": "{\"meetingid\": \"1764eef2-3a0a-4664-9226-0fb5813f8c14\", \"type\": \"Meeting\", \"reference\": \"MTG000747\", \"subject\": \"P0738-03, Vermilion waste management meeting\", \"status\": \"Closed\", \"meetingdate\": \"2025-04-07T00:00:00\", \"organisationid\": \"f878ad2c-b276-e211-9eb5-0050568a69e2\", \"location\": \"MS Teams\", \"regarding\": \"Other\", \"meetingtime\": \"11:15\", \"attendeesepa\": \"Mick Henry - Regional Manager\\nKealan Reynolds - Team Lead / Inspector\\nCatherine Organo - Radiation Protection Regulation Inspector\\nIsabel Kerins - Inspector\", \"attendeesnoepa\": \"Catriona King - Environmental Advisor\\nVincent Lang - Laboratory Team Lead\\nTony Reilly - Production Manager\\nDavina Burke - Health and Safety Manager\", \"actionitems\": \"

This meeting was held to discuss the licensee progress on finalising suitable disposal / recovery options available to them with regards to the on-site naturally occurring radiological material (NORM) waste being stored at the site. 

\", \"licenceid\": \"2e08f37a-e7c6-42d4-8ca0-b6e18b31a399\", \"originalmeetingid\": \"37f2bf54-5915-f011-a373-0050568a2d1a\", \"organisationname\": \"Vermilion Exploration and Production Ireland Limited\"}"}

{"compliance_id": "da1a4c4c-dd22-4c43-84f9-84b7e567893e", "document_type": "Meeting", "document_url": "https://data.epa.ie/leap/api/v1/MeetingCorrespondence/meetingbyid?meeting_id=da1a4c4c-dd22-4c43-84f9-84b7e567893e", "title": "", "description": "", "submission_date": "", "status": "Closed", "metadata": "{\"meetingid\": \"da1a4c4c-dd22-4c43-84f9-84b7e567893e\", \"type\": \"Meeting\", \"reference\": \"MTG000746\", \"subject\": \"Ringsend WWTP upgrade project update from Uisce \\u00c9ireann\", \"status\": \"Closed\", \"meetingdate\": \"2025-04-07T00:00:00\", \"organisationid\": \"f5545f77-3749-e211-9eb5-0050568a69e2\", \"location\": \"Online MS Teams\", \"regarding\": \"Compliance Investigations\", \"meetingtime\": \"12:00\", \"attendeesepa\": \"Lorcan Farrell, Stephen McCarthy, David Shannon\", \"attendeesnoepa\": \"Uisce \\u00c9ireann: Ringsend WWTP Upgrade Project Team, Compliance Team & Asset Operations\\n\", \"actionitems\": \"

A video conference meeting was held between the EPA and Uisce Éireann (UÉ) on 08/04/2025 from 12:00 to 12:50 approx.

\\n

During the meeting UÉ gave an update to the EPA on the phased upgrades being undertaken at Ringsend WWTP and a summary of treatment plant performance for Q1 2025.

\\n

Works on Hybrid II upgrades and sludge treatment facilities are progressing as scheduled with all primary aspects of the upgrade project due for completion by end 2025. A programme of ancillary works connected with the overall upgrade project is also being progressed with most completion dates falling within 2025.

\\n

A summary of plant performance was given. UÉ are aiming for 104 compliance samples to be taken during 2025. 10 no. samples records were recorded in the Q1 Update under compliance investigation (CI000025).  Compliance results were unavailable for the first three weeks of January. This was attributed to operational reasons (plant shutdowns) and management changeover. It is UÉ’s intention to make up the shortfall to 104 compliance samples over the year. It was acknowledged that there is a risk that TN and TP average limits may not be achieved this year. UÉ expect that performance will improve across all parameters once remaining upgraded SBR blocks come back on-line and as average air temperatures increase through the year. UÉ confirmed that higher than expected load on the plant (2.17 PE in 2024) was expected to continue increasing in 2025 and is also affecting treatment performance. Issues with the aeration system in the Capital Upgrade treatment block were also cited as a compounding factor in treatment performance and should be resolved by end April 2025.

\\n

The EPA instructed Uisce Éireann to carry out all actions necessary to comply with the waste water discharge licence.

\", \"licenceid\": \"4ab24fc5-2bf8-4aa8-ad9e-f4f68c559186\", \"originalmeetingid\": \"0d83b2ed-7614-f011-a373-0050568a2d1a\", \"organisationname\": \"Uisce \\u00c9ireann\"}"}
